Within an hour, the camera quit working.All I can assume is when Canon fixed the sand issue, they did not reseal to a standard that would keep water out of the compartment.  They were not good to deal with after the second issue.  I have since purchase a Fuji.When the camera worked, it took nice photos.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Harley M.
Reviews.Content: I haven't really tested it to the limits but, with a few dislikes, it's doing okay. Dislikes: Not as user friendly as my previous Powershot SD1000 (before I dropped it in the water!), difficult changing shutter properties (10 sec delay, etc), won't sit on a flat surface for 10 sec-delayed selfies. Looking forward to testing it underwater. I've had it 6 months.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Alisa
Reviews.Content: This camera made our vacation.  We had so much fun in the water taking pictures and not having to worry about getting it wet.  It takes great pictures and video.  Love this product.

Reviews.Title: buy this camera. ♥
Reviews.Author: amy porter
Reviews.Content: Ok.. it took me a bit to write this review. I wanted to be sure how I felt.I have taken this camera underwater in the Amazon, lakes & oceans, from the USA to Australia. I have amazing pictures... which I will add if it will let me edit later. I took it scuba diving on the great barrier reef and got better photos (it has a special setting) than  the people with more megapixels and fancy equipment.It took underwater footage of dolphins in the Amazon.I pitched it out of a MOVING VEHICLE @ 20 k.p.h. and threw it down concrete steps on Manly beach in Sydney, NSW, Australia.Not a problem! No leaks, no problems working. No lag time so you can turn it on and shoot immediately.If you need an underwater camera, buy this one!!!!!I would buy it 100x over.

Reviews.Title: One of my new favorite toys!
Reviews.Author: P. MSakamoto "boy clothes"
Reviews.Content: Last month, my wife and I went to Maui for a second honeymoon trip. Our adventures included a fair amount of snorkeling, and we wanted to take underwater photos. In the past we used a Canon Elph 400 for this purpose, mounted in a Canon underwater housing. It was a decent rig until it leaked last trip, so we were in the market for a new underwater camera setup. I found this one on Amazon and read a ton of reviews, as well as checking out the latest Olympus, Pentax, Nikon, Panasonic, etc. offerings. I chose this one and am glad I did.1. Menu familiarity. A big part of photo success nowadays is being able to quickly navigate the camera's menu screens and other controls. All of my other photo equipment (DSLR, compacts, camcorders, etc.) are all Canon. The menu system on this camera was immediately familiar.2. Rugged build and a shape that fits my hands. Some others have complained about the shape, but I like it. I also like the rubberized portions which help my grip.3. Photo quality. I took a great number of photos, and I have to say that I just don't get what those who complained of poor photo quality had issue with. A few of them obviously never figured out how to get the camera out of full automatic mode, so they were unable to control the ISO (film speed effective) adjustment. Once again, being familiar with the Canon menu system (or perhaps reading the manual :-) should clear those issues up. This camera is clearly NOT my big Canon SLR with L series glass, but it does compare nicely with my Canon S90 compact. The S90 wins in low light situations, but that is to be expected since it has a lot more lens. This D20 makes up part of the gap by having a sophisticated sensor. It has vivid colors, high resolution, and good contrast. When the light goes down, things get a bit noisy, but I found it all very controllable, either by working the controls, or by Photoshopping later on. In any case, I've shot a lot of small cameras and this one is competitive with the best.4. Video mode. It provided some decent video of a sea turtle in the water and a talking cockatoo at the Hyatt Kaanapali where we were staying. The sound was even OK, so I don't really get some of the negatives from others. It does not have comparable sound to my Vixia with DM30 mic, but that is not really the point of an amphibious camera, IMHO. This is good enough for what it is.5. View screen. Bright, clear, scratch resistant. I was able to take better pictures than in the past simply because this screen is big and bright enough to use while snorkeling in a sunny place.NOTES: I replaced the standard strap/leash with a "Chums" floatable leash. This is enough to float this camera and give you a bit of peach of mind. I attached it to the opposite side of where the normal strap/leash attachment is so I would not have anything protruding from the bottom of the camera. There is a place there where a shoulder strap or some such thing is supposed to attach.I used this camera underwater in the ocean, in the pool, under the fake Hyatt water fall, and on dry land. It was a champ all the way.

Reviews.Title: Not an aficionado, yet I mastered it
Reviews.Author: Nhitch
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, comfortable to hold and took great pictures on my cruise vacation.  The underwater shots were some of my favorites from the whole trip.  The battery lasted a very long time before needing to be charged.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: blane p berry
Reviews.Content: It's great for what it is.  Don't expect it to fill the shoes of larger fancier cameras with large zoom lenses and lots of fancy features.  My teen daughter says it will be great for her splash parties in the water with her friends.  It makes a great wet location back-up camera for my photography business.  No fear moving into the wet action.  I would think it would be a great hiking and outdoor sporting camera too.

Reviews.Title: i've dropped it and snorkeled with it
Reviews.Author: Mar
Reviews.Content: I drop things all the time.  This has survived a trip to Thailand, Malaysia, and some weekend road trips.  Takes great outdoor pictures and good (not great) indoor pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed!
Reviews.Author: Sean Davis
Reviews.Content: I was told by a friend that he loves this camera for underwater photos and traveling.  I purchased it and in my opinion I was not impressed with the image quality.  There was a lot of noise in the photos and the quality just looked poor.  Its also kind of bulky for a point and shoot.  I returned it to buy a Sony.

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera
Reviews.Author: Tee Bee
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon Junkie, every camera I have is Canon and I stick with Canon.  Bought this camera to take to French Polynesia to use snorkeling, at the beach, kayaking and just out and about.  The camera is pretty easy to use, there will be a bit of a learning curve on the settings.  Just make sure that before you go into the water, you change the setting to underwater and change it as soon as you get out of the water.  Photos will turn out a bit fuzzy if you leave it in underwater mode.  The video works great underwater as well.  We had so much fun with this camera and can't wait to take it on our next adventure.I did buy a new strap for the camera that floats.  The strap that comes with this camera is a bit awkward and frankly I don't like it.  It snaps in on the bottom corner.  I also purchased a water resistant case for the camera to put the camera in on the boat or in the bag to go snorkeling.  With the Canon strap on the camera is doesn't fit into the smaller case.  Canon could have come up with a better option for the strap.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!
Reviews.Author: Katrina A Remington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to Hawaii for our Anniversary. I wanted AMAZING picures as I knew we would not be going back any time soon. I was debating on buying a big DSLR camera or one I could take under water. I am SO happy I went with this one. This one takes just as good of pictures as the big cameras do AND you can take pictures of all the fun stuff under water. We went on a snorkeling tour and it was incredible. We swam with so many different kinds of fish and turtles and we have proof of it. Memories only last so long, but the pictures we took will last forever. It was super easy to use, I just suggest playing with it before taking it out. I HIGHLY recommend this camera to anyone going on a trip that wants great pictures, but doesn't want to lug around a huge camera. This one fit just perfect in my purse.

Reviews.Title: A bit slow and not as crisp as my Canon SLR - but it is small and waterproof
Reviews.Author: Cheryl "clo"
Reviews.Content: I needed a waterproof camera for a big trip - I went with Canon because have had two Canon Digital SLR cameras that I loved. I don't love this one - its a bit heavier than comparable sized cameras, it is slow and the focus seems just a bit off - probably because of the slowness.But I won't/can't take my SLR's where I take this so I'll keep waiting for a waterproof POS that takes good pictures fast.Note: Enabling the GPS capabilities kill your battery but it is really handy for trip logging.

Reviews.Title: So bummed.
Reviews.Author: A. Michals
Reviews.Content: I had the Canon PowerShot D10 and it was easier to operate.  It also had better features.  For instance, there was a shortcut to a "sports" feature--this automatically adjusted the ISO for you and focused quickly for shots of kids in motion.  This is no longer included in the D-20 and you have to manually change the ISO.  It's also now several steps to even get to the place that you can change the ISO!  By the time you change it the action is over and you've missed the shot.  I've also found that the "auto" feature is slower than it was on the D-10 which rarely, if ever, gave me blurry shots, this one tends to do it more often than not.  I was really bummed by the changes.  They added features (like more filters), but overall, my D-10 was better.  Also, my D-10 was so great that after seven years it was still working perfect and GOT STOLEN!  :(  I felt like a loss a friend.  The one advantage to this D-20 is that it's slimmer.  Another change that irritated me was that you used to be able to attach the strap to any corner...for a lefty this is perfect.  Now, you can only attach to the right.  The absolutely worst change they made (and I still can't believe Canon would be that flawed in their engineering to do this) was that they moved the lens to the top left corner (instead of the middle).  This means that where you would typically hold the edge of a camera you now cover the lens just a bit with the tip of your finger--I've had several shots ruined by the tip of my finger.  Overall, I was disappointed in the new version.  :(

Reviews.Title: Super durable and takes awesome pics!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer DeSaegher
Reviews.Content: We love this camera. Super durable. Have had it for over a year now. It's been in sand, oceans, rain, volcanoes and hot sun. It's everything it's advertised to be and it takes awesome pictures.It can sink pretty quickly though. We bought the kit with it that comes with the flotilla, carabbeaner strap, etc. and it's perfect. Gives peace of mind and kept the camera floating right along with us on snorkeling trips. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Worked great
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: It worked beautifully during my snorkling trip in Jamaica. The photos came out bright and clear! It held up when I banged it against rocks while swimming.. even my 8 year old niece enjoyed using it!It does sink, and fast, so I suggest making sure the strap is snug on your wrist. I also suggest practicing using it in the tub so you can get used to the settings and know what's best to use.

Reviews.Title: Water coming inside the lens
Reviews.Author: Beverly
Reviews.Content: Not recommended. Water comes inside the lens and just a couple of pictures taken, the lens tends to be foogy. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Steve Winn "srwinn"
Reviews.Content: Vacationed in the Turks recently, needed a all purpose plus water proof camera for lots of snorkeling and beach, perfect, perfect, perfect, couldn't be happier. It connected easily to my new i-pad, connector sold separately. Great size, tough case, 16 gig flash card, plenty for pic's, easy to use and best of all great pictures, friends couldn't believe the clarity of the underwater shots. Good for 40' so I'm told.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Underwater Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Camlet
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaii and did alot of snorkeling. This camera captured exactly what we saw. You could zoom in on the fish and coral and even the videos were phenomenal! We even did an evening Manta Ray excursion and those videos captured it all. I made sure I rinsed the camera with fresh water once we got back to the condo each time. We had to problems with the camera at all. I would DEFINITELY recommend this camera for underwater captures.

Reviews.Title: Its good
Reviews.Author: Liz-ard "person"
Reviews.Content: It takes good pictures except after I come out of the water and have those frustrating water drops on my surface images. I think I'll try some Rain-X next time. There are too many buttons on top and I'm constantly using the review button instead of the shoot button. Somewhat difficult to use and I'm going to have to digest the online users manual.

Reviews.Title: It leaked and was ruined right away
Reviews.Author: Alan Weiss
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip of a lifetime: the Galapagos. The camera seemed sturdy, and test photos were sharp and well-stabilized. I looked forward to documenting my trip.On the second day of the trip I went snorkeling in shallow salt water--I went no more than 10 feet deep. The camera stopped working after perhaps 20 minutes. I thought that the battery had just given out early. But when I got back on land and opened the camera and changed to a new battery, the camera still did not work. I finally opened the door that covers the USB port and charging port, and found water inside. The camera was ruined.After I returned to the US of A and sent the camera back, Canon replaced it promptly with a refurbished one. But I do not have much use for the refurbished camera--I bought the camera for one big trip, and it failed. I did get one and a half days of pictures, most of which came out very well. But I will never get back the seven days of missed photos due to the leak.

Reviews.Title: Everything I have come to expect from Canon
Reviews.Author: Adrian S. Kniahynycky
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon digital camera and my first waterproof camera. Takes great quality photos and HD video, controls & menus are easy to use and familiar if you have experience with other Canon cameras. Even if you don't use it underwater, it is great for taking pics around the water in general. Had it on a rafting trip and out on the boat so far, great to be able to jump in the water with it and snap photos while throwing the Frisbee around, etc. I highly recommend purchasing a float strap so it doesn't sink if you accidentally drop it.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot d20
Reviews.Author: tdinh
Reviews.Content: camera is differnt from d10 (which i loved).  menu navigation to delete, set up timer shots, etc is harder to do than the d10.  shape of camera is easier to carry because of slim profile. sad that only one port was set up for wrist string. bigger screen helps but flash only allows for auto or no flash (miss the manual override). overall good camera for water/shock/outdoor activities.

Reviews.Title: great pictures, leaks
Reviews.Author: keith Tower
Reviews.Content: We took this camera in the water about 6-7 times during a drip to Maui.  The pictures were great and we were happy with the camera.  The last time, the screen went blank and never came on again.  It was funny that it was still taking pictures, but the screen was dead.  Since there was no view finder, we had to quit using it.  No evidence of water in the ports.Now we begin the return process and are hoping that goes smoothly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, even in Antarctica!
Reviews.Author: Richard Jeong "world wide wander"
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a freeze, shock, & water proof camera for my summer deployment to Antarctica.  This is what I got, and have not regretted it.  The HD video on it is stellar, editable, and simple.  The photos are beautiful, and I've even had comments that they are better then some SLR's down here.  I keep it in my pocket all the time, for those crazy Antarctic moments when you want a quick snap.It holds up well in the freezing, the shock proof works, although it will reset power on it, and it's definitely water proof (in -2 degree water even).  My favorite feature of it is the inset lens.  I don't have to worry about scratching it putting it in and out of my pocket.  I haven't had any worries on scratches.The rugged and slightly textured exterior is very useful with gloves.  Manipulating with liners gloves is a simple operation, and the strap means it won't drop far. I do wish it had a time-lapse mode, but that's about my only function complaint.More on the camera after I use it during the austral winter, we'll see if it holds up to -40.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Laurent Cartier
Reviews.Content: We purchased the D20 one week before leaving for a trip to Belize.  We wanted to have one camera for both land and sea and thought the D20 would fit the bill.  The photos were very nice whether they were taken at a Maya ruin or under water.  We took underwater movies and photos and were pleased with the quality of the pictures.  Unfortunately, we did not have a chance to really learn all the features and functions of the camera before going vacation so some of the photos did not turn out great, especially when there was poor lighting.  Also, when we came back and looked at the movies, we kept hearing a knocking sound in the background.  We need to investigate the source of this sound.  Overall, the D20 met our expectation.

Reviews.Title: Extended warranty - not
Reviews.Author: S. Coleman
Reviews.Content: While I have yet to receive my Canon PowerShot D20, I have received the "Extended Warranty Policy" (SquareTrade.com) documents which I purchased with the camera. Since many underwater cameras often have a high rate of failure due to water leakage I opted for the extended warranty, just in case I had a problem within the first two years. Unfortunately, the policy expressly does NOT cover "water immersion"? What? This is an UNDERWATER CAMERA! Immersion is the whole point of buying one!Not only is immersion not covered but any "act of nature or any other peril originating from outside the product." is also expressly not covered. Is that sidewalk you just dropped it on outside the camera? Ok, the policy does say that dropping IS covered, so you can likely drop it and not worry, but since the camera is also shock resistant you may or may not think you need that insurance in the first place.If however you put in a claim for water leakage they don't have to do anything for you. When I called to cancel the policy they of course tried to talk me into keeping the policy, but given the undeniable terms of the "agreement" I could already envision the conversation I would be having if I had to file a claim for the same reason I bought the policy. You can of course trust them to honour their side of the agreement, but I don't personally put much faith in it since its all in black-and-white that they don't have to. Your mileage of course may vary.btw - My rating on this camera is only a four star simply because I do not yet have an opinion on the camera itself. I love Canon's products, as I already have three great SLR's. I have surveyed the market and this D20 looks like the best camera for the price given the tradeoffs needed for it to be water proof. I'll post an update on this camera performance after our next vacation, but I wanted to first warn any other people that might think to buy the warranty, to at least know and read what warranty exclusions I had found out about today.

Reviews.Title: Average Camera with Great Water Protection
Reviews.Author: Diego
Reviews.Content: Pros---------1. Great water protection. Used it for reef pictures and videos around 2-3 meters deep and  the seal stayed perfect.Cons---------1. Flash is super slow to recharge. If you bought this camera, you will be using this on a beach or a sunny area for sure. In bright light situations such as beaches, you must turn on the flash for most photos or else you will get overexposed shots due to sunlight. Unfortunately this Canon camera takes like 3-4 seconds to recharge the flash after each photo! Reminds me of the 1990s and Nintendo NES nostalgia.  Seriously Canon, are we still in the 21st century or not? I don't know what the designers were thinking here.2. The colored metallic area is all show and very prone to scratches. They should have stayed with 100% rubber all around the cause and not use cheap alloy metal plate for marketing purposes.3. The alloy/metallic screws that hold the camera together are not salt water rust proof. Yes you heard that right, a camera that's designed for under water photos has screws that aren't 100% rust proof when it comes to salt ocean water. What I mean is that if you used the camera in the ocean, make sure you  rinse it under fresh water afterwards or you will get yellowing/rusting of the screws a few days later.4. Heavy. The size is not bulky and actually quite nice but it sure feels like holding on to a rock.Summary---------Look, this is an very average camera at best with great water protection. When it comes to waterproof cameras, consumers don't have many choices and Canon D20 is already one of the best in the field but unfortunately when compared to regular non-waterproof cameras, image quality and photo shooting features are mediocre at best and highway rubbery at worst considering the cost premium over much better non-waterproof cameras.

Reviews.Title: fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: nnevison
Reviews.Content: of my gosh. I bought this camera just by the reviews. I was going to Hawaii and needed a good under water camera that took awesome pictures. I was so amazed how easy it was to video tape and take awesome pictures. I was truely amazed. I will cherish my pictures and camera always. Thanks Canon

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Jaime S. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent buy and at a good price too. I even stuck it under water to see if water would damage the camera and to my surprise it did not! The picture quality is also fantastic just remember to focus the lens.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera, but not perfect.
Reviews.Author: AdventureJosh
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research prior to purchasing this camera. I was looking for an underwater camera that was affordable, took amazing pictures and was durable. I was asking for a lot and there are several on the market that boast these claims. I ended up going with the Canon Powershot D20. The price was high, but more than worth it. It does indeed take stunning underwater photos and standard photos as well as great video. (for home movies, I wouldn't buy this to film your wedding) The build and design of the camera is very user friendly, a little bulky, but it easily fits into pockets or a backpack.It is not without some issues. The latch to the battery release tends to stick, it just requires a little jiggling and it latches fine, but it is something to definitely be aware of if you are purchasing.I highly recommend this camera to anyone on the market looking for a great affordable camera with underwater photo capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but may need some improvment
Reviews.Author: J. J. Guan "jj"
Reviews.Content: It's very good camera by this price, I bought it for my Cancun trip, good picture and video quality, I have no problem at all use it under water, fresh or salt, but only problem I have is the flash light, it only has 2 options AUTO or OFF, the AUTO sometimes not very smart, why can't have an flash ON option?also the camera video play back don't have speaker, BTW the software won't let me change the download directory.

Reviews.Title: First waterproof digital camera purchase lloveeeeeee
Reviews.Author: B. Bell
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is the best! I looked at other cameras and compared for a few weeks. i tested it out in wildwood, nj. i also had a lumix but i returned it. quality wasnt as good. but anyway, this camera does its job. easy to use, cant screw anything up. pictures and videos underwater are crystal CLEAR! clean up is easy from ocean. rince under tap water, and i let it sit for hour (long because im ocd and scared) and then i open the compartments to access the SD cards. everything has been dry as could be and more. id say consider this camera first before others. we loved this while surfing, and my first time videos underwater were a FB hit! i love it beyond words.i have pictures to share if youd like to see them, as well as movies! email me giddyuphorse86@yahoo.com and id be happy to share!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with my pics!
Reviews.Author: Doctor D
Reviews.Content: I'll start my review by saying I am NOT a professional photographer by any means. So keep that in mind.I bought this camera after doing very little research because I had a kayaking trip come up unexpectedly. I really wanted to be sure to get pictures on my trip, but I wasn't willing to take my Canon Rebel. Since I had never kayaked before, I was not sure if I would turn my kayak over during my initiation to kayaking. So I knew I had to get a waterproof camera.I am a Canon fan, so naturally that is where I began my search. From the very short time I spent on the internet reading reviews and reading information about this camera, it seemed like this was the camera I would buy. I did look at other waterproof cameras, but decided to stick to what I knew. I knew that thus far, Canon has not disappointed me.The problem I ran into was I had to buy the camera THAT DAY because I was leaving early the next morning for my trip. And it seemed like every place I called did not have this camera in stock. I did finally find it and was happy with my purchase.So, my unprofessional opinion is this:Pros:I took the camera out of the box, charged the battery, put the battery in and left for my trip. I didn't change any of the settings. All I did was pull the camera out when I got in my kayak and started shooting. I posted some of my pics here and I am pleased with what I got. And that was my goal - to get what I consider "good pictures".I like that it is approved for a depth up to 33ft. Some of the other waterproof cameras I came across were only approved for up to 16ft.I don't think it requires you to read all the instructions to be able to use the camera right out of the box. In my opinion, it is very user-friendly.I did not actually take an underwater picture. So I can not speak for how the camera performed under water. But I had to have an underwater camera specifically because obviously it could have ended up in the water. So I wanted it so I would not have to worry about the camera getting ruined by splashes or by an unexpected swim in the ocean. And obviously I wanted it to be good enough to take better than average photos. So for my needs, it exceeded my expectations.Cons:In comparison to other waterproof cameras, in general this Canon D20 was slightly larger/bulkier. And the shape of the camera is still puzzling to me. I held my hand all kinds of ways and could not figure out why the curved shape on the side of the camera you hold with your left hand. At first, it almost encouraged my left index finger to place itself in front of the lens.The price was a bit high. However, I did find it n sale for the same price as Amazon, but had to "fight" for a price match at the place I found it. I like buying from Amazon, but that was not a possibility since I needed it the next day.I do not like how the button you press to snap pics is in between two other buttons - one being the power button. Granted, it is a bigger button that than the other two buttons, I still hit one of the other buttons several times when I meant to snap a picture.I do not know if this is the norm, but it was a bit concerning to me that there is no lens cover. Well, I guess since it is waterproof, there probably is a glass or plastic cover over the lens, but I would like there to be some sort of shield that would cover the lens so it would not get scratched. Only time will tell if this will be an issue.The pictures seem to come out well-lit, even in bad lighting. However, when I was pointing the camera toward a brighter background (i.e.. the ocean), it messed up the exposure of the pictures and they came out a bit washed-out.Yes, I did point out more cons than pros. But I feel like my "cons" are more "user-preferences/nonpreferences". As far as camera performance, I am very happy with my purchase.I will add more to my review as I use the camera over time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the outdoors & underwater
Reviews.Author: Yaya
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moJG4W0ULF0LNU', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moJG4W0ULF0LNUloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } } } Length:: 0:19 MinsAfter doing a bit of research on underwater P&S; cameras I came across this one. I was a little hesitant as there weren't many reviews of this camera, specifically video or pictures using the camera in the environments I would (ie, pool, underwater, water park rides, etc). However, based on the very good written reviews provided here by some of the earlier adopters of this camera and a few videos on YouTube I decided to buy it and I'm so glad I did!! I wanted the camera before Memorial day so I purchased the expedited shipping and it arrived May 25th(purchased May 24th). I was super excited to get this camera in the water and I did just that on Saturday at the pool with my daughter and friends we also took it with us to Sea Worlds Aquatica Water Park on Monday and captured some awesome pictures and video.Con: Has background clicking noises while filming under water and don't know what causes it. Also the sound under water isn't to great. Another issue that I didn't like is that although I do not have to stop recording to take a picture, once the picture is taken it doesn't resume recording.Pros: I like that the camera automatically adjusts to your surroundings with lighting, darkness and capture awesome video and pictures without you having to constantly change the cameras settings. I also like having dedicated buttons for recording, on/off, video/picture playback and a button to take pictures. I also like the fact that the camera was ready to take pictures right out of the box (after charging the battery which doesn't take long).Overall this is an AWESOME camera and I love using it. I'm sure I'll update my review as I get more use out of the camera. I love the image and video quality both in and out of the water.

Reviews.Title: Camera buttons stopped responding after an hour
Reviews.Author: Craig Iskowitz "ezragroup.net"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because we were planning a trip to the beach.  The camera worked fine for the first hour we were there.  I took pictures and video both in and out of the water with no problem.However, after about an hour or so, I noticed that the zoom buttons stopped working.  I could take pictures, but couldn't zoom in or out.  Then I tried the other bottons on the back of the camera and discovered that NONE OF THEM WORKED ANYMORE!  The buttons on the top of the camera still worked (Power, Shutter and Playback) but none of the other buttons worked at all.  Zoom, Menu, Arrow Buttons, and Function Set were all dead.  The camera is next to useless at this point.More good news is that the Canon website has no useful troubleshooting information.  Lots of info on how to take pictures, but nothing on how to resolve problems with this camera.  Totally useless.They have a phone number, which is an automated help line only and is also useless.I would avoid this camera unless you want to roll the dice and take a chance that you will buy a Powershot D20 that doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Dont waste your money!
Reviews.Author: melanie
Reviews.Content: Bought this brand new for a 9 day Eastern carribean cruise and it worked properly for about 20 minutes. None of the buttons would work..would not zoom, couldnt access menu to change settings, etc. Big disappointment!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: A double very bad experience!!
Reviews.Author: Liliana
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my vacations in august 2012. It lasted only 5 days and amazon replaced it. It worked well outside the water. Now i am in a ship in the bvi and the first time i want to used in the water it is all black. I will hardly recommed canon to take this product out and stop selling it , because is not reliable under water that is it main use!!!

Reviews.Title: D20 rating
Reviews.Author: Anna L. Zettle
Reviews.Content: I picked the D20 as a replacement for the D10.  I loved the D10; I purchased it because1.  I have had great experiences with Canon as a whole.  Their reps I have talked to regarding camera issues have always been met with good results.2.  I bought the D10 because it was waterproof and it had video capability.  The D20 is a much better camera in regard to the zoom.  I love it.This camera, as was its predecessor, is in my purse all the time.  I can't count the number of times I have grabbed it for a quick photo op.  It is the only camera I take on our yearly trips to Mexico.  I don't care to subject my 50D and 60D to the salt and sand of the beaches.  The D20 is point, shoot, and wash off if I get it in the salt water.I would highly recommend it for anyone wanting a waterproof camera that takes great pix.

Reviews.Title: After 1,058 pix I like it alot.
Reviews.Author: M. M "M M"
Reviews.Content: Just got this last week. I wanted a smart point-n-shoot to replace my larger Olympus 4.0 megapixel C-765. It must have been one of the first digital cameras. It also still works. But it's big, dated, and doesn't do video, obviously. In Maui I need small, durable  with video and waterproof. I also need a camera smarter then it's operator.  This new one takes a 16G SD card. It still has about 2/3rds the room after 1,058 pictures and a good half-dozen videos. I DO recommend a spare battery upfront. I've yet to regret this decision. It's also about half-charged when you get it. I'd also say delete as you go along. Sorting through 1,058 pix at once is a PITA if you can avoid it.  I bought this at Calumet Camera on Chicago's 1111 Cherry Street, where Division comes into Halsted. We also have to support the little guy every once in awhile, lest all the small stores go away. I was getting confused with too much info and just wanted a nice, durable camera. That's what I got. I wanted professional advice, got that, too.  Also, I wanted to help Americans keep their jobs, as well as not support any anti-American activities. Know the company you are dealing with. Watch "The Corporation." Lots of popular companies use American business and American money to support terrorism. Brick stores cost more money than a site. But you get what you pay for. A Pinto is a car, too, but you can't compare it to a Maserati. And while I never drove a Pinto, thank God, I have driven a Maserati. Trust me, I'm sure it's better than driving a Pinto. But again, if you don't care or can't differentiate, then don't bother with the extra expense.  Camera does NOT come with an SD card. At all. Buy the spare battery now.  As I said, so far, I like it very much. I kind of hate having to sort through 9,000 reviews by people who could just be well, idiots. I always read the 1-star first, and see if it has any merit at all.  Ok, this does a very nice point-n-shoot. I use the wrist strap so I won't have to find out how durable it really is. It also does nice FX like miniature and so on. I never use a flash, except as an effect, NOT as an excuse for not going and finding a light. I'm with Stanley Kubrick on a flash being the work of satan, basically.  Charging, be aware a dead-to-full charge is about 2 hours. If you're really going somewhere photogenic, make sure you don't forget that. In 1,058 pix, I charged three times. First was for the 1/2 charge battery that was as I got it. I don't leave it on standby too long.  I must have about half a dozen short vids, also.  Try to compare it to your normal camera at the store. With your iphone or your old camera. If you're not impressed at the store, then don't do it. I compared this to the new, NEW, Boost Mobile HTC One sv. The Canon wins by a long shot. The Canon is cleaner and brighter, with better color. A pro photographer told me he really loves the iphone camera. There's a ringing endorsement. And perhaps a worthy comparison?  Bu going further, what do you want it to do? Take a pic? Be durable? Waterproof? Do vids? Be sharp and clean? If you just need a phone to ring, you don't have to bother with a very expensive iphone. If you're fussy, then you'll be happier with this than junk.  Take two pics of the same thing with both cameras under identical conditions, and see what you like.  Oh, there are NO instructions. Printing them yourself took me a LOOOOONNNG time. There are, no kidding, 220 double-sided pages, literally. So you can either print or memorize. There's a lot for a camera with 8 buttons. It DOES come with a data cable, which is real nice. I was told to use a card reader if you have a slot or a USB adaptor to put the SD card in.  Battery pops out when you gently pop the red tab inside the door on the bottom, then the SD card is easier to access, as it's next to the battery. Push it down a bit, and it will pop up.  I was accidentally shutting it off, as it's next to the shoot button. A lot of it is self-explanatory. But after 220 pages, I see that it does much more than I know about now. This is precisely what I wanted, and I'm very happy with it. I will try to put up some nice pix.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D20 - Well Worth the $$$
Reviews.Author: Toys_n_Games
Reviews.Content: Wow  I am totally shocked at how well this camera preforms.  Is it the perfect camera for every situation?  No.  Is it a good alternative to SLR, No.  But for what it is designed for, size and price, this camera over performs.  Well done Canon!For everyday normal use this camera does rather well.  You have to be diligent about wiping\cleaning the attached clear lens cover as it easily steams, fogs or smears.  No, it does not come off, not intentionally.  Water droplets tend to stick or leave a wavy trails.  Keep a microfiber cloth always at hand and you'll be just fine.  Menu system took a little while to get use to but that goes with just about any new camera.Oddities...  The shutter button is centered between the ON\Off and Play buttons on top of the camera.  I hit Play on numerous occasions when I didn't want to.  You have to reach a little further than what you would expect to pop off a snap.  Again, just something you have to get use to.Separate Wide and Zoom buttons not particularly fluid.  I prefer a rocker button.  Train your fingers and you'll be OK.The good...  Indoor, outdoor and low light images are great bordering on fantastic.  Does pretty well on the Fireworks setting too.  Gives other PowerShot models a run for the money.The awesome...  Underwater.  Excellent pics even when not using the underwater setting.  Of course distance from your subject is dependent on the clarity of the water but in normal, clear pool water 4 to 8 feet seems about right.  The one drawback is that it is nearly impossible to watch the LCD screen to center your subject.  Point and shoot doesn't really describe the necessary action.  Guess and shoot would be better.  Wearing goggles or a mask would help but I haven't had the luxury yet.Take LOTS of underwater shots.  You'll get lots of butts, legs and empty water shots but with a little practice you'll get your subject.  Maybe not perfectly centered but that is what resizing and cropping is for.1000 + pictures and video taken so far and haven't touched the Program\Manual setting - haven't had the need.5 Stars because I bought this for water park pictures and it is that and much, much more.  Can easily become your normal, every day camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jaden
Reviews.Content: Used this at great wolf lodge, took great photos up until It started getting water on it. Some of my pictures had blurry marks from were there was water on the lens but I think that's kind of expected. I also took this to a paint party and it took awesome pictures! It even got some paint on it but I just washed it off and it was fine!

Reviews.Title: Great HD Videos
Reviews.Author: F. Aguirre
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a Grand Canyon rafting trip.  Took absolutely great HD videos.  Never submerged it totally.  Very pleased with camera.  2nd Canon we own.

Reviews.Title: Pretty decent for what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Steffie B
Reviews.Content: Compact camera that has a nice display and takes good pics. I take mine everywhere. It's my camera, period, and as such has to be pretty rugged. It's "Stephanie Proof". It goes kayaking, on big bike trips, to the beach (mind the sand), and the Grand Canyon, cross country skiing in the snow, too. It loves to snorkel. Yes, you can use it right out of the box. But I do find the menu much more difficult to navigate than its predecessor's (I loved that camera right up until the second someone stole it in Queens on the 5 Boro ride). If I want to set up a timed shot, I have to unhook the wrist strap unless I happen to have my mini tripod with me, and it doesn't park as easy as my beloved predecessor, either. I just miss the earlier version of this camera. But it takes great pics, even at night and without the flash (which I admittedly hardly ever use). I'm still learning things about it, too -- just discovered the editing options. You'll be satisfied, big time.

Reviews.Title: A Canon
Reviews.Author: WFO
Reviews.Content: Typical Canon. Works just like it says. We have had so much fun with this camera. We dropped it overboard while fishing offshore and luckily we had the Chums waterproof camera float. We have taken this to the beach, the class IV rapids and the pool. It has never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Kitty
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera, it took great pics and was easy to use. Bought the kit to go with it so I wouldn't lose if it falls into water.Will certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera
Reviews.Author: drebdog
Reviews.Content: I am an outdoors adventurer and got this for that reason. This camera rocks!  Went scalloping with it and the underwater picture are top quality with no distortion. Did a Suwanne River kayak trip and it performed flawlessly and the cord is perfectly sized to secure to the boat and still take pictures. Mounted it on a Pedco UltraPod Lightweight Camera Tripod and put the ultrapod in the end of an 18" long 1" diameter PVC pipe and used it to take pictures and video of our Warrior Dash experience and it performed without a Hiccup, plus the small lense area was easy to clean with a bit of water even after the muddiest sections, will be posting a video soon on youtube. The included Canon software is incredible for modifying pictures and making innovative videos

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Katrina K. Oberhelman "Katrina"
Reviews.Content: My friend and I go to the springs in Florida a lot and I wanted something I could take pictures with after using a friends underwater camera. I love this camera. It works great and had the best reviews as far as quality and not leaking, although some people had problems. I did not though. It worked fine for me! :)

Reviews.Title: A good underwater camera - only get the new D30 if you need the extra waterproof depth.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Pantliano "The Photo Guy"
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot D20 is a nicely done waterproof digital camera, and unless you need the extra depth rating of the D30, stick with the D20.  The new model doesn’t offer a new lens, sensor, or processor, so photo quality and performance should be similar.The one thing about the D20 that stands out is that it is built like a tank.  Everything feels well put together and the buttons and doors all feel high quality.  The doors have silicone seals to keep out water, click shut tightly, and have spring-loaded releases to make sure you don’t accidentally open them underwater.  The D20 is a bit larger than you might expect and has decent heft to it, but it’s never a problem to carry around all day or stash in a bathing suit pocket.  The Canon feels good in the hand and all the buttons are large and easy to use.  The shutter button is a little spongy, however, and watch where you place your fingers as they are easy to get into the photo.Included with the Canon is a heavy-duty wrist strap that can be attached on the right hand side or the bottom left corner with the included snap on holder.  The problem with attaching it on the bottom left corner is that the Canon will not stand upright when the strap is attached this way.The D20 is very simple to use.  For those who want the camera to do all of the work for them there is the smart automatic mode.  It tries to figure out what you’re taking a photo of to create the most pleasing result.  There are also a handful of scene modes and creative filters.  For those who want a little more control there is a program mode, a long shutter mode with options from 1” to 15”, and custom white balance available.Performance wise the Canon is average.  It takes 1” to focus in good light and about 2” to focus in low light.  It turns on quickly, however, and is ready to shoot in 3”.  Continuous shooting speeds are about 1 photo every second and I took 40 photos before I stopped, but the Canon could keep going.  Moreover it only took a couple of seconds to write those photos to the memory card and be ready to shoot again.  The screen gets a little jerky when continuous shooting but it’s not hard to follow your subject.  The D20’s GPS works well and takes only a couple of minutes to acquire a signal.Picture quality is very good for a waterproof camera, but the Canon is let down by its 5x lens.  The lens is very slow (f/3.9 - f4.8), which means that it can’t collect a lot of light, resulting in higher ISO speeds and lower photo quality.  Some cameras in this class offer an f/2.0 lens (the lower the f/ number the more light the lens can collect).  Additionally, the lens is blurry in the extreme corners and shows a bit of purple fringing and vingetting.  The lens does have an image stabilizer, however, so you can keep ISO speeds down when taking photos of static subjects, and I was able to get sharp shots at 1/4" at wide angle.  Outside of the lens’ negatives, the Canon takes nice photos.  Color, exposure, and contrast are all good.  The photos are bit soft on close inspection, but detail remains high even as ISO speeds rise.  I would recommend shooting from ISO 100-400 ideally, 800 when necessary, and 1600-3200 in emergencies.  Lastly the maximum shutter speed is only 1/1600”.Videos are recorded in full HD at 24fps with monaural sound.  I found the video quality to be high and you’re able to use the optical zoom, although you will hear the motor in quiet environments.Battery life is good.  I took over 100 photos, a few videos, zoomed a lot and played with the menu and the battery only half depleted (all while the GPS was on).I used the Canon in water and didn’t have any issues with leaks.  Make sure you check the seals for any debris before going underwater, and rinse the camera in mild tap water after each use underwater.  By following these simple rules you can make sure the Canon will last a long time.All in all… a nicely designed waterproof camera that deserves a better lens.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera, amazing image quality
Reviews.Author: FrankeO-57
Reviews.Content: This is possibly one of the best water proof cameras out there. I have use it at the beach, pool, sand and mud... no issues... insure the  lens is clean and you're good to go..

Reviews.Title: Hard menu navigation
Reviews.Author: Lynda C. Reed
Reviews.Content: I love Canon for clearer pictures and natural color. But the menu on this is confusing and hard to learn which setting you need to be in to access certain menu options.

Reviews.Title: Good while it lasted - but it didn't last very long
Reviews.Author: Victoria
Reviews.Content: We had the camera for less than a year, before water ingress caused the camera to stop functioning. We had taken care to keep the case closed.  It's a shame because - apart from the expense of a replacement - the camera worked well until that point.

Reviews.Title: Identical to D30 but with greatly improved case and depth rating?
Reviews.Content: I own the D20 and love it! Good image quality (IQ) for a waterproof camera (Sorry, IQ really is relative as non-waterproof point-and-shoot (PNS) cameras at this price point have far better IQ). My D20 handles continuous bouncing in my front pocket while trail running with no problems yet after about 6 months of solid use. 50 to 100+ miles of bouncing in my front pocket or backpack so far. I love the Color Swap effect mode as well. I have not submerged it yet but it has been rained on many times without incident.So this brings me to the D30. I cannot find anything different with it other than the case (and modest button layout change) and depth rating from the D20. They both have in common:12.1MP 1/2.3" CMOS sensorDIGIC 4 image processor5.0mm-25.0mm F3.9-4.8 lensISO 100-32003.0" 461,000 pixel screenFlash range 1 to 11 feetSame Scene ModesShutter Range 15sec-1/1600sec1.9fps maximum frame advanceNB-6L batteryAnd on and on...I honestly believe that the D30 is the same camera as the D20 in a different case. And I have to admit, I can't stand the D20's case as it's got a very awkward shape and it is very slippery. I literally smeared Shoe Goo all over the front and sides of it for grip. My girlfriend HATES the way it looks now but has to admit it solved the slip problem. The D30 addresses the slipperiness of the D20 with an actual finger grip on the front. Plus the D30 has a totally different depth rating of 82 feet, which is 49 feet deeper than the D20's 33 feet. This is something that really interests me as I had a Lumix TS3 fatally leak at literally under 8 INCHES submersion shooting video in a koi pond while being rated for 40 feet. Depth ratings are lies and all I need is a genuine, no-excuses-never-ever-fail-for-any-reason depth rating of 10 feet. I figure an 82 foot rating should genuinely provide 10+ feet.So aside from drastically improved depth rating and case design, can anyone verify any differences between the D20 and D30? Thanks! :)

Reviews.Title: Good Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Mary McMillen
Reviews.Content: Took pictures and video underwater with no leaks or damage, while snorkeling.  Pictures under water were not as clear as I like, but they were pretty good.  Much better than a disposable underwater camera.  Pictures on land were great.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!
Reviews.Author: J. Kazmar
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a vacation to the Caribbean & it takes the most amazing pictures. The camera spent 6 full days in the ocean, pool and going down rides at Atlantis and took the best pictures.  I love this camera and am so happy I bought it.  I have even have friends ask to borrow it b/c they love the pictures it takes.

Reviews.Title: Big disappointment
Reviews.Author: Brynn Gute
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera.  I had it for a little over a year, didn't use it that much.  I took it in the ocean 4 or 5 times before it leaked and was completely ruined.  And it leaked at the very beginning of my once in a lifetime trip to shark cage with great white sharks.  Very disappointing.  I always took care of it according to the instruction manual and washed it after going in the ocean, so I don't know why it suddenly broke.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great
Reviews.Author: B. Bethea "Barb"
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures in and out of the water.  It is small and lightweight but the screen is big enough to read it.

Reviews.Title: Leaked on first use
Reviews.Author: gggirls
Reviews.Content: Bought this last summer knowing we had a Hawaii trip upcoming.  Leaked on first use and is past return date.  We had purchased as a friend has same camera and takes best underwater pics we've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: Powershot waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Cybercat "geocacher"
Reviews.Content: Fabulous fabulous quality pictures ........great little camera.  However, we took it on a vacation to the Galapagos just a month after buying it and after only 5 days, the display went out.  Thank goodness we had already taken many underwater pictures and videos before it decided to stop working.  We were able to take the remaining few days with a smartphone camera, but no more underwater.  That's exactly why we bought it was for the underwater capability.  Still under warranty so sending it back.....I was very impressed with the quality of what we were able to film, though.

Reviews.Title: Good, Not Great.  Some Issues Seem Likely to Develop Over Time
Reviews.Author: R. Walker
Reviews.Content: I am a home inspector, so I got this camera because it wouldn't care about crawlspaces, rain (like today), etc.  I use the camera in VERY extreme environments and it has to perform.  In general, I have not been disappointed.  I had the D10 before this one.  The D10 was flaky.  I had well over 60,000 pic's on it (yep.. at least).  It took forever to focus and shoot and would randomly shoot out of focus.  The D20 is much faster in this regard.  So far very few out of focus shots.  The D10 also had a hard time focusing in dusty areas (like a dry crawlspace).  The D20 suffers the same issue.  It seems a little more forgiving in that regard though.  I think this has something to do with the underwater focusing mode, but am not sure.Where I see a future issue coming with the D20 is the battery/memory card door.  The latch and door is a plastic material.  The door latch is very difficult to operate.  The D10 had a metal door and was much simpler to open.  I can see this breaking at some point in time.  But only time will tell.All in all, it seems like a decent camera.  The normal lens has wider coverage than the D10.  The zoom is much faster to respond.  The D10 was very thick/bulky.  The lens really stuck out on it.  The D20 is much smaller - relatively speaking that is.  It is still much larger than a non-weatherproof camera.  I am sorry I didn't purchase an extended warranty when I bought it.  The door seems likely to break and I'd rather fix than replace.  What kept me from buying was some of the warranty company reviews on here.

Reviews.Title: awesome waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Tracy Bezdek
Reviews.Content: takes awesome pictures and video.  the video looks great on a '65 tv.  The underwater function works great.  Used it underwater in the ocean and did get it wet and underwater on a river falls excursion and it works awesome.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: The Beez "Geo B"
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on my cruise and it was amazing!  It took great pictures and as long as I remember to clear the drips off the lens, when going from underwater to above water, it transitioned beautifully.  One of the pictures I took turned out better on my camera than on my sister's fancy camera.  I was continually impressed by the pictures I took.

Reviews.Title: Great, rugged, easy camera!
Reviews.Author: Rain Levity
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a cruise ship when both my digital camera AND my cell phone died on our first day at sea. I paid a little more, even duty-free, than it costs here, but I'm still happy. We took pictures of our whole week-long vacation with this camera, and most of the pics came out pretty great. We even took it on our snorkeling adventure, and used it to get pics and video of the fish, coral, turtles, and each other, while in the ocean. It is definitely rugged, it pinpoints where you take the pics (you can turn that features off pretty easily), and upload is a breeze (SD card, NO USB). No, it isn't a super-high-quality fancy-shmancy deal, but it certainly gets the job done, and is easy to operate. Neither my husband nor I are any kind of photographer, but we were able to get pretty decent pics in all kinds of conditions- from the night club to our tiny inside cabin, to the beach. And what's more, I feel OK letting my kids grab this camera and take some pics, because I'm not worried they'll break it or mess anything up. It is really rugged. I take it to Water Country USA all the time, the park, the local pool, and out in the snow or rain or whatever, without worrying.Finally, my favorite bonus features is that it has a rechargeable battery. I really hate having to replace camera batteries, or running low just when you leave the house. It's been more than a year since I bought this camera now, and it still holds a good charge. I seldom charge it, but it seems to last a good long time with normal use. Video is a simple button-push, zoom is easy enough for my toddler to figure out, and although I rarely mess with any settings, they're pretty straight-forward when you want to change something.I highly recommend this camera for folks with young kids, anyone going on a cruise or beach vacation, or anybody who just wants a good, reliable camera that can be taken anywhere.

Reviews.Title: I love this Water Proof Camera
Reviews.Author: Manfredo
Reviews.Content: Very good resolution it is all that you need if you need take pictures under water with very good quality. 5x optical zoom its enough if you want to take a pictures making snorkel. Strong design to supports falls or knockings. The camera comes with a internal GPS in order to take geo-refered pictures its a very cool feature.

Reviews.Title: The best small camera!
Reviews.Author: Lydia Hiott
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my teenager to take to Europe. You just would not believe the beautiful quality pictures that he was able to take. A professional photographer mention that he thought the pictures were taken with an expensive multi- lens camera.Slips easily into a day bag too!!

Reviews.Title: Fun, Rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: The Canon D20 is a fun, rugged camera. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that there are many cameras and makers that deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and find out what else is available for your specific need.The Canon D20 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 12.1 resolution (megapixels), and a x5 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CMOS-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 3200. That rating is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 461,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need that only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The burst rate is a reasonable 1.9 frames per second- for quick shots. The weight of the camera is a convenient 228 grams.Canon D20 comes with GPS, it is waterproof to 33 feet of depth, freezeproof, and shockproof.Overall, a fun camera for the outdoors. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: zoe
Reviews.Content: My daughter is a photographer and she wanted something small that she could take with her on vacation when she didn't want to haul all her equirement - fun camera - takes great pictures

Reviews.Title: Works Fine But ----
Reviews.Author: Wayne Olson
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine. Pictures aren't as sharp as previous Canon Power Shot but acceptable. Like the size and button for quick video start and stop.  Haven't had it under water yet.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Holt "mook"
Reviews.Content: We are always in the water and this camera always comes with us now! Easy to use and takes great pics! Husband loves it too! Buy it if you want an underwater camera but don't want spend tons of money!

Reviews.Title: pretty cool camera, so far works great
Reviews.Author: hk
Reviews.Content: works great, tested the underwater functions first day, amazing pics in the pool.  worked great out of the box, we'll see how long it'll last. my last 2 powershots crapped out after a year'n a half. But overall a great little cam that can go pretty much everywhere

Reviews.Title: Great photos & Videos but ....
Reviews.Author: Javier Ezquerra
Reviews.Content: The camera have outstanding capabilities to shoot good photos, having in mind its price and goals.Beside of that I would rate it as poor constructed, because it stopped working after 1 year & 3 months.It was properly used, never diving more than 3 meters (it is said that the camera is 10 mt / 33 ft. waterproof), but water leaked inside and now the camera is out of order.I expected more from a Canon waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked great
Reviews.Author: T. Jolly
Reviews.Content: Bought for a cruise, for beach and underwater (snorkeling) use.  Also purchased a separate floatation strap based on comments here about the strap coming off with unfortunate consequences.Worked very well - no leaks or other problems, although we were careful to soak in freshwater after use in the sea (per the instructions), and also very careful that there was no sand in the battery/SD card seals etc.Underwater pics and videos were pretty good all things considered, definitely met expectations.Outside the water though the picture quality is mediocre, possibly worse than current gen smartphones.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the beach!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Edens "catmando"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera because I got tired of worrying about my other camera getting wet, sandy, etc. at the beach. This is the perfect solution. Actually does well uderwater too. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Peter from Seattle
Reviews.Content: I was worried a bit about this camera leaking as some reviewers have mentioned, but decided to go ahead and risk it anyway. Long story short, I’ve been snorkeling with it for 11 days, down to about 15 ft and the camera worked well beyond my expectations. I made excellent images, movies (with sound). Some reviews mentioned problems with the microphone, but I did not encounter that. I was using it in and outside water and it always worked well.One note of caution: keep an eye on battery levels. Depending on the selected options, you can run it flat in no time. Originally I turned everything on (GPS, logs, etc.) and puff, it needed charging. With all that off, it was quite reasonable. So, the camera has all the features and you can decide to use them or not.Oh, and another thing, make sure to get camera float, especially if you are planning to let your kids use it. I had one and it saved me a number of times! Without it, this camera would be on the bottom of Pacific now.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater photos
Reviews.Author: estates
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera to use in/near water, or in situations where there's a risk of getting the camera wet. However, the colors seemed a little off, but it was easily fixed on the computer. Overall not the best quality photos, but worked great for our trip to the Galapagos Islands last spring. Wouldn't have gone without it.

Reviews.Title: Solid all around Camera and most importantly it WORKS
Reviews.Author: Chad J. Cook
Reviews.Content: Took this on a 7 day caribbean cruise.  Multiple excursions including snorkeling swimming with dolphins, rays, and climbing falls.  Worked like a trooper with no leaks and solid video and undersea photos.  Best of all I could let my kids use it (6 & 3) which they do anyways whenever I'm not looking and it took multiple drops on solid surfaces with nothing but a little surface scratch to show for it.  Only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars (and it's a bit unfair given the class) is the quality of the photos is worse then my Galaxy Note 2 (but I knew that when I got it).  If they could make one of these tough, waterproof cameras with the high quality photos of their comparably priced non waterproof cameras I would love snatch it up in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: This reiview is more about Amazon than the camera....
Reviews.Author: R. Baker
Reviews.Content: My entire review can be read at vegastriguy.com/amazon-miracles/It goes without saying that I probably spend about 80% of my disposable income via Costco and Amazon.  Those two retailers have such permanent mind-share that whenever I have a purchase need, I think of Costco first and Amazon mostly second.  No brainer.This past Sunday, December 22nd I completed a little side job and deposited some cash into my personal checking account so that I could eventually order a replacement camera on Monday.  I was scheduled to take a friend to the airport at 5am and when I returned at 6am I placed my order.So, after many years of being a professional commercial and stock photographer, the economy and economics of maintaining my six-figure camera quiver had been whittled down to my smart phone and a PNS (point and shoot).  I originally purchased a cool little Canon D10 that was waterproof and adventure tolerant.  The shape of the camera was a little bulky so I upgraded to the new Canon D20.  The sensor was much better and the the shape was more pocket friendly.I lost this camera by leaving it on the roof of my car in a remote area and as I recalled my error, I was 30 miles down the road.  Upon return to the scene of my idiocy, the camera was long gone.So, after this last little job and with my previous research, I was 100% planning to purchase the Olympus TG-2.  It looked sexy and just pretty much awesome for $329.  On Amazon, the designated vendor was Samy's Camera in NYC.  Not a fan and for no particular reason.  But, since I was not really going through Amazon I visited the Adorama website.  If I purchase camera gear outside of Amazon, I prefer B&H; or Adorama.  BTW, I had received a $50 gift certificate to Amazon which was influencing my final decision process.  Adorama was offering overnight free shipping for the same price as the Amazon price via Samy's.  I was JUST ABOUT to pull the trigger and then I went back and compared the specs of the Canon D20 and the Olympus TG-2.  With the exception of the Olympus being much sexier and probably having a better bomb-proof rating, the actually camera specs were about the same as the Canon D20 for $100 less money.  Mind you, all this comparative analysis is going on at 6am in the morning with 3 hours of sleep.I go back to the Amazon site and confirm the lesser price of the D20.  I really did want to try a new camera but for an extra hundy?  THEN, on the Amazon site it tells me if the order is placed by 9am, I am guaranteed same day delivery...that means like that same day!As far as a camera review, this is a great little camera...I always post-process my images in Adobe Bridge (I have a quick post-processing workflow) and with very little effort I get great shots.  Low light and action shots are not it's strong point.  Video and underwater shots are great.  The newer shape (versus the D10) are easy to throw in a pocket or the back of my cycling jersey.  This is one of those cameras that gets very little raves but really does a GREAT job in the under $300 range.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: MARC E COHN
Reviews.Content: Just got back from maui.  Wow my pics are great and my videos, WOW.. HD is great.  My first time scuba diving I am so glad I had my new camera with me!  Bright, in focus pics.  The battery lasted for the whole week.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: jjj
Reviews.Content: Have used it for over 6 months - dozens of times underwater, even accidentally to 70 ft. once (forgot it was in my BCD pocket). I have since used it a little past its depth limit several times (not recommended).  Now, every once in a while the autofocus takes a little while to kick in (but I suspect it is due to my abuse) but other than that everything works fine. UW videos are high quality. It sure beats a bulky UW housing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: My hubby got me this camera for our cruise. I took over 400 pics and video and a lot were underwater. Love that its compact and easy to carry around but still does tons of things-zoom and go from underwater to normal. I even hit a rail on the boat and the camera was fine! Hubby even took video going down big slide on ship. Highly recommend this camera!! Great job Canon!!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: John Armstrong
Reviews.Content: I have a few cameras.  However on a fishing trip this summer, my guide had an older version.  I had my old canon tucked away in a zip lock bag so it would not get water damage.  Trouble was it took some effort to extract from my pocket, remove from the baggie and take a picture.  This camera has a unique design - but takes great action shots.  Its our new adventure camera- fishing, skiing, hiking - anything outdoors

Reviews.Title: Versatile camera
Reviews.Author: trailblzers
Reviews.Content: We grab this camera first even though we have a DSLR.  It is convenient and durable and we are happy with the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Paul A Flores
Reviews.Content: great point n shoot waterproof camera. you won't regret it, and is very durable.  The GPS works great as well.

Reviews.Title: Solid depedable camera
Reviews.Author: S. G. Sheridan
Reviews.Content: The first impression I had of this camera was how solid it is. After reading the reviews I chose the d20. I've used other Canon digital cameras and was satisfied.  My main purpose for use was for kayaking and an upcoming trip to Hawaii.  After a few snorkeling adventures it has performed great. The underwater colors came out true.  I do recomemend a spare battery and a float.  The only "even better if" would be to place the on/off button in a different place or further from the shot button.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos Underwater and On Land
Reviews.Author: Consumer "nesodifl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter who spends a lot of time at the beach (saltwater). It has been reliable and performs very well both underwater and on land. In fact, a photo she took with this camera of a rhino on safari won an international photography competition -- against much more expensive and professional cameras. It is a great buy for the price. She has never used the camera more than 10 feet deep so I cannot comment on it at depths greater than that.

Reviews.Title: Loved the camera!
Reviews.Author: Pam Hickox
Reviews.Content: This camera has performed great for me! We took it on a cruise and used it from everywhere like open air, in a hot tub, in the ocean. It takes great pictures even when not under water. Overall, you should study the camera and know where the buttons are you intend to use long before you get in the water.I didn't try any of the fancy features - just zoom and basic photos.I did change the battery, even once while at the beach snorkeling... I kept in mind the concerns people have posted and had a dry towel and made sure the entire camera was dry before opening the door. I double and triple checked the closure too and I had no problems with leakage.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy and practical
Reviews.Author: Niervana
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate. Very sturdy (it has survived quite a few falls). Cool design. Pretty decent underwater camera. We bought it twice as we lost the first one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but Seals Failed Over Time
Reviews.Author: B. Corsi
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a trip to Australia. It worked wonderfully during snorkeling, scuba diving, and swimming around. Also used is a few times snowboarding and in the ocean taking pictures. Almost exactly a year later, I used it snorkeling and it took on water and shut down. Luckily, I was able to dry it out, but the seals seemed to have failed. While it worked, it worked great, not super happy with it now. The picture quality was great, both under and over water. The zoom was a great feature, the screen is nice and big, and the buttons are easy to press. I took great pains to ensure that I maintained the camera properly after use in water and am disappointed in the performance of the seals.

Reviews.Title: Not so good in salt water
Reviews.Author: JiCiT
Reviews.Content: Pictures are nice.  I couldn't get very good macro shots with it.  I'm sure it work fine in fresh water, but I was using it in salt water and it died within in a couple months.  Given the salt, just letting it dry out after use wasn't effective.  I'd recommend to anyone looking for a waterproof camera in this class and that plans on using it in salt water, to just get a "regular" camera in the same class along with truly waterproof case...maybe two for good measure.

Reviews.Title: Awesome and Incredible without a doubt camera, waterproof!!!
Reviews.Author: Jose Zamora
Reviews.Content: The camera was given by me a large and exciting rating of 5 stars because it got the job done!!!

Reviews.Title: Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Shirley G. Young
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take kayaking and playing in the pool with the grandchildren. We have used it a lot and I get ok photos. The grandkids get a kick of having a camera in the water. Never any problem with water getting in the camera and we have used it a lot. I have prints made for the kids and they are ok.  If you are only going to use it for water areas I would recommend, but if you are looking for a point/shot that gives good quality photos I would not recommend. Recently took it on a cruise, since I did not want to carry around my heavy DSLR. Many of the photos were cloudy even though at times shot in the same spot as others that were clear. Quality of shots were not consistent. For a Canon product and the cost of the camera I was very disappointed

Reviews.Title: Best underwater camera
Reviews.Author: elliotte
Reviews.Content: Best under water camera I have owned. Better than the Olympus I owned previously. Takes a good underwater pic and a decent out-of-water pic. I have a $1,500 Cannon that takes an amazing pic, so obviously the powershot won't compare to it. Overall, great lil knock around camera to throw in your bag for the beach, boating, and any kind of weather condition. I took it snowboarding and kept it in my pocket. Got some great pics! Took it to the Caribbean and got some cool underwater shots.

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kristin McKnight
Reviews.Content: This camera is incredible!  I just took it on two trips to tropical places and it takes great pictures in and out of the water, even nighttime - you just have to make sure you are on the correct setting but even Auto is good.  I had read the reviews and observed the difference in the 2 underwater pics between this camera and the Panasonic Tough which made up my mind and I made the right choice.  Even a friend who takes underwater pics regularly with a professional camera was impressed with the photograph quality!  I highly recommend this camera and recommend that you purchase the floatation device that keeps it above water in case it is dropped. Don't even hesitate :)

Reviews.Title: A rugged camera that meets all my expectations
Reviews.Author: green jay
Reviews.Content: A rugged camera that meets all my expectations. I am not a professional but sometimes need to take pictures or projects. This is a camera I can carry in my pocket to dirty, muddy jobs. The GPS function is better than no GPS, but could be improved.

Reviews.Title: Good size and versatile
Reviews.Author: RCJose
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Good size, and improvement over its predecessor the D10 which was a little bulky.  This one fits much better in my pocket.  We take it wherever we go whether its skiing or snorkeling.  Durable too, so I don't worry too much about my kids dropping it.

Reviews.Title: Impulse buy
Reviews.Author: D.
Reviews.Content: And turns out I love it!  I've never spent so much on a camera before and I was having second thoughts straight away but I took it to Hawaii with me and I LOVED it.  For an amateur like me I got some incredible shots, under water and also out and about.  It's so easy to use and I'm incredibly pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Joshua P Foltz
Reviews.Content: Good camera! I love underwater modd. You can get a Fuji camera for around $150 but it's not worth the money, my Fuji underwater camera failed about the 4th time using it. This Canon is a great camera for underwater shots, recommend it, worth the extra money for something that will last.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: pacecar21
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because well it's awesome!! I have a cannon elph 100 and i fell in love with it immediately!! Then sadly i lost it for a few months :( Coming into summer i knew i'd be spending lots of time in and around water, so I looked into this one and it met all my expectations! It's been everywhere, lakes, rivers, rainstorms, the water park... etc. It takes great underwater pictures as long as the water is somewhat clear, even when it's cloudy you get a cool picture sometimes. and how many waterfights have been had over the history of the universe and there are no pictures to document?!? I used this camera at a family reunion during a waterfight in a rainstorm! and i'm happy to say i'm the only one that got awesome pictures!! I didn't have to jump out of the way yelling "camera! camera!" awesome action shots! lots of settings. The only downside i think is the size and shape. it's a little bulky, can't really tuck it in your board shorts or back pocket, but other than that this camera is great!

Reviews.Title: Heavy duty and grandchild proof
Reviews.Author: Nicki Tyler
Reviews.Content: The pictures are good (not like my BIG Canon), but I can carry this camera to babysit my grandchildren and if they get a hold of it, well, it can take the beating!!  Love it and it has already outlasted all my previous "hand-held" mini cameras.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot d20
Reviews.Author: stan o taylor
Reviews.Content: bought this camera for snorkeling, did a great job and easy to use. next time i will get the floating strap for the camera, as this would of helped in carful not to loose.
