Reviews.Title: looking for the waterproof camera? THIS IS IT!
Reviews.Author: Chepiina
Reviews.Content: i got this for my vacation coming up in about 6 weeks and while having it in hand, i've been testing it. took lots of shots of my furry babies and it came out like a professional took it! it was awesome! it's a tad bit heavy but it's worth every penny i spent! :) looking forward to taking pictures on my vacation! :D

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot D20
Reviews.Author: Phil Brooks
Reviews.Content: I take a lot of family and friends snap shots inside and outside all in auto mode works great. All outdoor sportsmen will like the durability and waterproof features this camera has. I sure have .

Reviews.Title: The Best!!
Reviews.Author: Lat-B "Lat-B"
Reviews.Content: We bring this camera everywhere!!!  Its been to Asia, South America, 30 feet under water and 10,000 feet above sea level.  Never failed!!!

Reviews.Title: it does the job and does it decently..
Reviews.Author: GOPAL K NAYAK
Reviews.Content: I have been reading reviews on under water cameras since the inception of these products. All kinds of mixed reviews never did help make up my mind on pulling the trigger on any of them...This canon D20 is no exception either.. it has its share of "bad" to "not so great" reviews. However, I am canon believer when it comes to point and shoot cameras. Based on that believe, i got this cam. glad to say, it has worked well so far..we have done a couple of trips to thailand with this camera and it took some good under-water pictures while snorkeling and in the hotel poolcons..weird shape, bulky (only slightly) and tries very hard to look like a fish (it does not need to)prosdecent outdoor shotsreliable underwater performance.built strong, does not handling with white gloves on..great battery life.

Reviews.Title: underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: This thing is amazing I was stunned at the quality of the picture we got ( wife and I ) if you can hold youself still and or time your photo as sealife rarely poses for you it comes out sweet.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: bought this for a trip to Thailand, absolutely loved it! amazing photos, it also made it through many ocean adventures and rain (which it is meant to do, but a lot of times underwater cameras break or leak when exposed to water)...this camera is very easy to use, sturdy, and again... the photo quality was great

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Christina V Goats
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my first Cruise in July..I almost did not have it in time for my trip.It was 4 days late in the mail.But it got there and I used it under the water snorkeling and it took awesome pictures...

Reviews.Title: Water Proof Camera
Reviews.Author: Valerie Tucker
Reviews.Content: This was a great bargain and is very efficient.  We still have a lot to learn about it.  It is cute, small and very effective.  We needed a smaller camera with zoom power and that was water proof.  It actually takes pictures under water and was a true bargain.  We are excited and satisfied. Amazon is great!

Reviews.Title: Not only waterproof, but sand proof too
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: Okay, my model is much older but basically the same thing. First, I love cannon and have never tried other water cameras so I can't speak for them. My camera I bought over three years ago and it still takes perfect pics. I use this camera for surfing. With that said, this camera has been in some heavy stuff and can take a beating no problem. I even have to give props to the strap being that I have been pounded so many times with the camera getting ripped from hand but the strap always saves it. I use to be careful with it but after three years I'm not at all. I now just shove it up my wetsuit pant leg with strap around my ankle, surf and pull out whenever I see those magical moments in the water. I've dropped it in the sand a million times and hardly ever soak it anymore. Still works, salt and sand resistant.

Reviews.Title: It's really neat!!!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, it was a good investment! I love taking pictures of my daughter swimming under water.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Eric & Alfie
Reviews.Content: Tried this camera out in the beach and water park in Cancun and it worked great.  Even submerged underwater!  The quality of the pictures came out great when the water was clear.  Had to wipe the lens a few times but I think all cameras will be like when in water.

Reviews.Title: Didn't Last Long
Reviews.Author: ReikiRobyn "reikirobyn"
Reviews.Content: Display died within two weeks. Now have a refurbished replacement that;s okay so far. Underwater pictures are looking okay now.

Reviews.Title: just came back from key west, and got great shots underwater!!!!
Reviews.Author: Alexander W.Bauert
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!!!! I have read a lot of negative reviews on this , don't know why??? its a great camera!!! HIGHLY RECOMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: great 2nd camera
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Serrata
Reviews.Content: It's everything I got it for. Took it to Mexico for a wedding before I had time to really get to know the camera and the picture came out great.

Reviews.Title: Great pool /outdoor/ boating/ snorkeling camera
Reviews.Author: Ezra
Reviews.Content: I have about 6 other Canon cameras because I like the picture quality and the features.  I bought this to replace a Canon D10 that was about 3 years old and leaking.  I was VERY pleased at the new features of the D20 over the D10.  This has pretty much the same features that the S95 has but not all the manual controls.  It's sturdy and waterproof to 30' but you have to make sure you keep the seals clean to ensure you don't leak.  Don't use anything with lint to clean the battery or digital compartment doors as the lint will make a leak if caught in the seals.  I've dropped it a bunch of times and had no issues.If you take in the pool or saltwater just soak in in fresh water for about 15 mins and then dry it before opening the battery or data port.Feature and quality wise this is the top of the line waterproof camera on the market. Again, it's only rated to 30'  and if I'm deeper than that I use the Canon S110 in a dive housing.The buttons and functions are all easy to use with gloves on and the logic of all the function menus are much easier than other similar cameras.The picture quality is exceptional and the battery life is about 500 pictures. The video is good but the video sound is not as it's in a waterproof case.  All waterproof cameras have this problem.There is a good underwater color correction mode that works fine and it actually is a great all around camera even is you arent' around water.It's definitely a little bigger than other point and shoots but it's very sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Great Low Light and Night Pictures.
Reviews.Author: EB
Reviews.Content: So far so Great with this Camera.  Have been totally pleased with it.  Can take 300+ pics on a single charge.  Just purchased an extra battery to have along while camping.  Have take some extremly awesome pics of sunsets and rises while out fishing.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: haydee torreon
Reviews.Content: A little bit big though, but it is still nice. Having hard time looking for a case for it. the picture is so nice.

Reviews.Title: Bought for snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Ross
Reviews.Content: We used this camera on a cruise we took in May 2013. We LOVE it. The picture quality is amazing underwater and above. We love the big viewing screen. We used it in salt water and just washed it in fresh water when we were done for the day. Haven't had any problems with it yet. Very durable and on the heavier side. I'd recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Likes and  dislikes
Reviews.Author: Stephen L Crocker
Reviews.Content: I like the features and that it is waterproof. Although it has many options in the menu I miss the touch screen options that my last camera had. It seemed to be easier to navigate with a touch screen option. This may not be available on this camera because of the water proof feature. It does take good pictures

Reviews.Title: Excellent tough point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Timothy D Smith
Reviews.Content: This is my forth one of this particular Canon D20!  I keep giving them to the adult kids when they like them and the results of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: pics
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's the photographer, but the pictures aren't as clear as I had expected. I will give it more of a chance. I need to try it under the water.

Reviews.Title: no regrets!
Reviews.Author: Alisha Bascombe
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pictures so clear. The underwater function is also wonderful and  takes clear pictures.Besides the underwater feature, I really like the vivid function that makes your pictures pop, and the other various functions I have not seen in other camera brands.I have no regrets about purchasing this camera. It's really awesome!The only downside i'll say is that it's a little big but it's nothing to worry about. Also, I expected the camera to have a sport (fast movement) feature. Mabe it does and I have not searched for it properly.I'll buy no other camera brand besides canon.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures.
Reviews.Author: Lorissa Penner
Reviews.Content: This camera is nice.  I have dropped it a few times and hasn't broken yet.  My only problem is with the battery opening.  I find it really hard to open and close.

Reviews.Title: So much fun!!
Reviews.Author: Jo R.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!  We go to the lake a lot, and I always want to take pictures, but I am scared to use my iphone or my Nikon D3000 close to water!!  This camera is so much fun, and it takes great pictures.  I have taken pictures under water several times, and it works great!!  Most of the time, I am in the water, taking pictures of people (and dogs) jumping off the dock.  I am very pleased, and can't wait for summer time again!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Mg058
Reviews.Content: The best camera i ever have, great underwater photos, easy to handle, i Am going to buy the next model because it would be better

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: Camera worked as advertised. Photos are clear, focus good as expected from handheld 'pocket' camera (heavy for everyday pocket camera).Took photos to 30ft and in beach surf. There are 2 presets for underwater and had to play with them each dive because of lighting, surf and other variables usually made one work better than the other. It is hard to do custom setting while bobbing around in the surf but switching the presets was easy. Also, it takes getting used to seeing the object you are trying to photograph on the LCD (again...conditions influence this). The photos were good but colors were a little muted relative to colors I was observing. Make sure you rinse sand/salt off with fresh water after swim.Land photos were good for the most part. One complaint is that in Auto exposure, you cannot force a flash it only has auto flash and no flash. There are times, especially when out in the sun where you need a flash fill. On this camera you have to change modes to force this.GPS found us most of the time...will be interested to see if this is a useful feature.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: Overall a great camera. Very durable, picture quality in and out of water is great. Could be a little faster on the shutter.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised!
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Wooten
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Hawaii and it worked flawlessly. I used it in fresh water and salt, no problems, great pictures and video. The controls were easy to use while snorkeling. I used the camera in conjunction with a floaty device just in case the camera slipped from my hands in deep water, but I kept the provided wrist strap on and that didn't happen. I would recommend this camera to any novice or casual shutter bug.

Reviews.Title: Very nice so far!
Reviews.Author: A. Rathbun
Reviews.Content: I had a 10+ year old Canon S30 with a waterpoof case for our once every 2-3 year snorkeling adventures.  I adore that camera, and it takes better images than most new cameras, but it was time to retire it and the massive case.I looked at all the options on the market, and I seriously considered the Panasonic.  The image quality reviews are a bit better than the canons.  Ultimately, though, I went with this one due to a noticeably higher number of water seal failures noted in the Panasonic reviews.  I've also stuck with Canons exclusively through many camera purchases, and the familiarity of the controls and menus was a small factorPros:- Size isn't tiny, but it's less than 1/3rd of the volume of my old S30 + case.  Still small enough to put in a pocket.- All controls easily accessible.  With the case products, some controls aren't easy to hit.Cons:- The two  options for attaching the wrist strap are kind of bizarre.  Either on the right side on an annoyingly placed removable attachment - this makes it impossible to set on its bottom for self-shots or other needs.  Option two is on the left side, which might be a little unwieldy for a right hander.- Screen is pretty much invisible underwater, even on full brightness.  Not sure how other cameras fare, but probably similarly.- The shutter button and power button are right next to each other on the top.  Both are round.  You will inevitably turn your camera off instead of taking the shot you want.  Repeatedly.  It's a little frustrating, but at least the camera turns back on fast.I've taken this on two snorkeling trips with maybe 6-7 salt water immersion / drying cycles.  I probably had it about 10 feet deep at the most, and rinsed it off with fresh water after each trip.  It's perfect so far!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: mario rivera
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great one. The pictures are extremely clear and I am talking about under water pictures. Best water proof camera built. I love Canon. Recomend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: good for active use
Reviews.Author: blogger
Reviews.Content: it really depends on how you'd like to use it... the camera is very solid, waterproof, and rugged-looking. i have no problem taking it anywhere from skating ring, to snowboarding, to diving.However, don't expect fantastic DSLR-level pictures, or even on the level of some other high-end canon point-and-shoot cameras. This camera works well in daylight but does rather poor job in low light, saved by relatively well-processed/low-noise high ISO and adequate flash.

Reviews.Title: charging up time to take a picture
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Weiner
Reviews.Content: I had the D10 for the last few years. I was very pleased with its performance and picture quality. My shutter broke and Cannon fixed it. It happened so I decided time for next camera. I looked at all of the new underwater cameras--Olympus, Nikon, Panasonic etc. I like the feel of the new Canon. I trust Canon--I have a great SLR and a history of Canons. I like the 5 zoom and improved video. Ca someone comment on the lag time between shots. The time for the  camera to get ready. Someone commented that it takes 20 seconds.  That seems excessive. How could it be. From those that have been snorkeling, what has been your experience--taking a picture then waiting for the  next shot-is there a dealy or what  Thanks so much

Reviews.Title: Great toy
Reviews.Author: Nathan Chor
Reviews.Content: The Canon D20 has a reasonable image quality for a waterproof camera. It's sturdy, has a GPS and a very useful customizable self-timer. The GPS drains the battery quickly, so when it's being used, it's better to have a spare battery. I also use this camera in sandy places, like sand dunes.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended after field testing on Spring Break 2013
Reviews.Author: Workhardplayharder
Reviews.Content: I just took this camera on spring break 2013. I dropped it onto hard surfaces twice (accidentally, of course), I left it baking in the sun on the beach (accidentally, of course), I used it in and out of the pool, on the water slides, and on snorkeling excursions on St Thomas and Nassau, and I used it as both a still camera and a video camera to capture memories ofnthe trip.This camera performed great in all of these instances. We have had fun playing the beautiful HD video on our big screen TV.Pros:Tough as advertisedWaterproof as advertisedAwesome HD videoMeets expectations as a compact still cameraA lot of fun, and easy to useCons(only one)The video can appear jumpy and frenetic if you aren't careful to move the camera slowly and stabilize it when filming video.If you have used Canon equipment in the past then you will understand my next statement...it works like a Canon(which is high praise).After testing it in the field, I fully recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing underwater pictures
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter's vacation in the Bahamas.  The pictures she sent back were astounding.  As the trip went on, you could tell she was not doing a good job of cleaning off the lenses with fresh water.  Dad intervened with some maintenance...good as new.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Dawson
Reviews.Content: I have done about 10 dives now with this camera and the rubberized outside makes it easy to hold, the screen size is awesome and it is durable as well.  Very unique shape that is great for gripping.  The strap is a well woven, easy to adjust accessory that I had no problem adjusting to even though I am not one who likes strapping equipment in.  Video is colorful, pictures are vibrant.  I take this camera out to the club, in to the campsite and...of course...underwater.  Keep em coming canon!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Karin Calderon
Reviews.Content: It's the waterproof camera I wanted, no I need to learn how to use the different functions it has. But I love the idea that is waterproof and shockproof

Reviews.Title: So far we really like this camara
Reviews.Author: Amy Muir
Reviews.Content: So far we are happy with this camera. We haven't hit the pool yet so that will be the deciding factor. The start up and first picture time is much faster than our Sony DSC... but the lanyard is awkward and the additional lanyard attachment on the right hits the palm of your right hand which makes it difficult to feel like you can securely hold the camera and one handed shooting is out of the question unless you are left handed.Update May 27 2013: Used it in the pool, no leaks or other issues. My husband still loves it, (it was a b-day present. Best feature according to my husband is how fast it starts up and is ready to snap. He catches more of those "only for a moment" shots.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: angie froehlich
Reviews.Content: Just used this camera on a cruise.  We went snorkeling 3 times and the camera worked so great.  The pictures turned out amazing and it was definitely worth the money.  I also used this camera just as my every day camra and these photos look great too.  Would definitely recommend this to anyone.  I purchased the Chums Waterproof Camera Float  to go with it just incase the camera got dropped (it does float).

Reviews.Title: So far, it is great!
Reviews.Author: Court
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera because of all the great ratings.  We are planning a tropical vacation and wanted an underwater camera to use while snorkeling and swimming.  So far, we have used it underwater in pools and in rivers.  I have taken it with me on several fishing trips and have taken underwater photographs which have turned out great.  The overall photo quality isn't perfect, but it is the best I have seen in an underwater camera!

Reviews.Title: Great clarity
Reviews.Author: Karen Giordano
Reviews.Content: Used this camera on a recent trip to St Thomas - easy to use, Picture clarity was great. We have used other underwater cameras in the past, no comparison. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: kcrawford "kathleen"
Reviews.Content: It is really waterproof! And, take nice photos. We bought this for a snorkeling/sailing trip and we were surprised at how well it worked. We had one instance where the LCD screen fogged up while we were hiking, but it cleared itself up after a bit. We've used it on land and it takes some nice photos.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: D. Failla
Reviews.Content: i love this little camera, i actually took it to vegas to test it for the weekend and took great photos. then my weenie dog is doing swimming therapy and the vet was hoping to see how he was doing underwater so i asked if i could bring the camera and the quality of the video is great! definitely recommend the product

Reviews.Title: for on the go lifestyle
Reviews.Author: Jay_Are
Reviews.Content: Was in the market for an all around camera that fit my active lifestyle. I dropped and broke both of my Canon PowerShot SD630 so I was just waiting for a Canon D10 upgrade and luckily this came at a perfect time before my Florida trip. I did consider the Nikon COOLPIX AW100 but since I'm a loyal Canon customer I went ahead and purchased this anyways.This camera and I have gone through some rough times and it has survived. I've taken amazing shots while on the beach, snorkeling, snowboarding, boating, camping, hiking, rafting, and pretty much any activity outdoors.I don't thing the size is too bulky (better than the Canon D10) at all. The strap attaches on the bottom right with a twist and lock feature, i've left it dangling from my backpack never once has it unattached itself from the camera. It doesn't fog up when taking underwater vid/pic. Obviously you can not expect to have a good quality sound when its underwater. The construction is sturdy, hasn't had any scratches on the body as well as the lens or viewing screen. I give the battery life a 7/10 though, but i can understand when shooting HD quality videos and pictures of course it'll use up more power. Over all very satisfied. I've also used this camera for gatherings and it does the job as needed.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: 'Chelle
Reviews.Content: I love my new D20. Bought it last year for a trip to the beach. It worked great, both above and below salt water. Both pics and video turn out great. Going on our first cruise in a month and I can't wait to go snorkeling around the Bahama Islands with it. Wanting to capture some wonderful memories with my family.

Reviews.Title: Amazon to the rescue
Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: First of all 5 stars to Amazon. Our Pentax Optio underwater camera died while snorkeling in Maui. We knew we would be in Oahu the next day and Amazon drop shipped the Canon camera next day to our hotel.The camera is a bit bulkier than my last camera but the picture quality seems more vibrant for underwater pictures than any of the Pentax underwater cameras that I have owned.Battery life has been excellent.The one thing that is a bit annoying is the strap on the left side, if you want the strap on the right side they provide a little screw mechanism that snaps in but it gets in the way and I'm worried it will easily unsnap.

Reviews.Title: Durable and easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera after some very quick online research as we were leaving on vacation in three days and had lost our camera.  We were pleasantly surprised by the durability, ease of use, and quality of photos.  We also used the camera in Belize during snorkeling excursions, it took great underwater pictures.  The only downside to this camera was that if you like to set up and take timed photos, you need a tripod.  This camera does not sit up well by itself.  I would recommend this camera especially if you are active in your travels.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for people that break things.
Reviews.Author: Bizzle
Reviews.Content: I've always been hard on electronics.. I mean, really hard, and this thing is holding up fine. My friends often ask me if I've managed to break it yet (I used to go through 2 of the original Elph cameras a year, and roughly 2 smartphones a year), and I happily report to them that I have not.

Reviews.Title: canon d20
Reviews.Author: Lparpard
Reviews.Content: Canon has come thru again ..... I have canon top of the line 35mm .... this is the camera that is my work horse who would have thought ...... great for macro ... and travel ...... this is my second d20 ..... recommend it highly .... love Canon

Reviews.Title: Big but great
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the waterproof option. It can stand more than the equivalent from Sony although it is bigger. I have dropped the camera and I have taken it to the ocean to take pictures while snorkeling, the picture quality is great as it is in every cannon product. It is on the bulky side so don't buy it if you want it to fit in your back pocket. One thing I don't like from the camera is that it will not stand still because of the wrist cord connector so the screen will get scratched.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera
Reviews.Author: JB4kids
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Kodak Easy Share sport 123 and the improvement is signifficant. I have several Cannon cameras and had been waiting for a replacement for the D10 and I am really pleased with the D20. The quality of the pictures it takes compared to the Kodak in the same conditions is much better. It is everything I had hoped for, perfect for me. I do a good amount of snorkling and with good light this takes very sharp pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: N. ILL
Reviews.Content: I used it in my last trip. It was good for outdoor (under water). The pictures were clear in most cases

Reviews.Title: Used this for Snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Scott Culbertson
Reviews.Content: the 12 meg camera and the ease of setting video mode was great.  I many times dove to around 20 feet and found no issues with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Timothy
Reviews.Content: Camera performed better than my expectation. One must take into account the lens and zooming mechanism is totaling inside the camera body. The still capture is very good if set to correct settings. The manual focus capability was helpful for underwater capture. As expected the video mode suffers a little. The audio pick-up is poor and low light levels are to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: pet doctor "dave"
Reviews.Content: This is a preliminary review since I just bought the camera for my wife at Xmas, but so far very pleased.  Excellent features, large and clear screen, and the photos are very sharp with or without flash.I'll update once I've had it in the water, since I bought it mainly for the waterproofing.

Reviews.Title: Excente producto
Reviews.Author: Lucas Marrero
Reviews.Content: me gusta mucho la calidad del producto, Cabe mencionar que incluyendo los accesorios adicionales de la oferta son excelentes, llegaron en buen estado, muchas gracias.

Reviews.Title: best point and shoot ever!
Reviews.Author: V. Voloshinov "uz2b_L.O.S.T."
Reviews.Content: wow - i love canon cameras (i have canon 60D) and, this one is just amazing. I take it with me to every vacation i have. Mexico, NJ shore - anywhere there is water - i use this camera in and out. Great underwater pictures and videos! And, just as a camera, on dry land! :) Thanks! Love the product and totally recommend it! and i did read a lot of reviews about other brands. This one wins by far!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Casual Warrior
Reviews.Content: Began looking for an all weather camera that could withstand the elements I.e. hiking, running etc. took this camera with me to Panama and the reproduction was awesome. Went sea and pool bathing with it and had a great time with it in the water. Most of my hikes are along river beds and waterfalls and I am not shy to get the camera wet.Also had it on a Caribbean cruise and the GPS works great.i was able to plot the course over the Caribbean Sea and various islands. Recording the descent on the water slide was unbelievable. I always wanted to capture moments like these.I have no issue with the kids using it because of the shock proof feature if it should fall.I would strongly recommend getting a flotation strap for it, just in case you accidentally drop it in the sea / river, it won't sink.One downside - It's a bit on the heavy side but you get accustomed very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: David Zhao
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our trip to Bora Bora last month. We were amazed at the quality of the photos taken by the camera and its robustness underwater. This thing is tough, we took it to scuba diving at about 10 ft deep,  We had a Sony underwater camera before and it broke during our trip to Hawaii in the Westin swimming pool. The Sony camera looked nicer from a exterior standpoint, but the build quality suffers.One mode that we particularly liked on the Canon D20 is the movie digest mode. When you are taking photos in that mode, it automatically captures a few seconds of video right before your shutter is pressed. At the end of the day, it combines all of the clips as a daily digest. It turned out to be a fun way to see what you've done for the day.I highly recommend this camera, as with most of the other Canons that we'd owned.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D20 is a good buy.
Reviews.Author: Saint Barts Diver
Reviews.Content: This is my first underwater camera and I used it while shallow diving on Saint Barts.  I was worried the first time I plunged into the salt water holding it, but it has now been on two dives with zero leaks.  Taking pictures while wearing a face mask takes a little practice, but I could easily operate the camera while under water.  The camera is very solid, but buy the camera float with the camera.  This baby will sink like a rock if you let go of it.  I tested the float by releasing the camera in a shallow area and it floated up to the surface. I am happy I bought the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: J. Perovich
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for one trip to San Diego and thought it would produce only mediocre results. I call myself an amateur professional photographer- I shoot a T3i with an assortment of lenses in nature and also do property photography for real estate. I know a fair amount about cameras and photography in general.The camera itself is easy to use. Yes, its a little funky to look at and they do have better looking waterproof cameras but this one feels sturdy. I used it on a jet ski. The wrist strap proved invaluable when I flipped off into the ocean and the camera was still strapped on. Note: The camera does NOT float. Back to sturdy- chances are when you are in a water environment the camera is going to bang around and possibly be dropped- no worries here. The metal body and rubber grips are great. Buttons are large enough. The funky curve on the side does fit your finger nicely.The picture quality was great- some complain- cant figure out why. I have always shot Canon and especially love their Digital Elphs dating back from years ago. The Power Shot line is excellent. The thing I noticed was that they pictures were always crisp and never under exposed. It compensated with flash more times that I would have personally but it made the subject just pop.The HD video works great as well. I would probably use this camera in place of my older digital elph except the blue case looks a little funky in more sophisticated settings =)I highly recommend this camera, worth it in the long run.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: So happy with this camera.  Took it on vacation and the picture clarity is awesome.  Would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a not only an under water camera but for regular photos to

Reviews.Title: I Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Ramsaroop
Reviews.Content: First of all this Camera is very w2ell made, sturdy and tough, no lie but i dropped down a flight of stairs the 2nd day I had it lol (the reason i bought this camera in the first place) it had little sighs of wear and still works great, picture quality is very good and the HD video is clean but a lil laggy just a lil (because i didn't have a high speed SD card on it, got one so video does not lag anymore) nothing that bothers me. the screen is big on this camera which is great underwater and will be buying a camera float strap soon cuz this camera will be on all my hiking trips in Trinidad.Update: this camera for 9 months now, it captures great pictures and video both on land and in water, has been on endless trips with me on dates, hikes, camping and other events. the camera is still fully functional and has gone through alot, this camera is very rugged and tough and gotten alot of abuse and torture because of the way i use it. Sometimes scaring myself thinking that to broke it, i feel on this camera twice, the first time i feel i used to to break my fall on some sharp rock all it has is minor scratches, other than that works fine and i have no problem. Will be uploading some pictures of what i have described in my review. Hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: jshadrick
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  It takes great pictures and I'm not worried about breaking it every time I take it somewhere.  The only downside is that its rather large and heavy compared to most cameras.

Reviews.Title: Love canon.
Reviews.Author: Jaime E. Rivas "Jaime rivas"
Reviews.Content: Really great camera for the price and plus its a canon camera, can't go wrong with it, alway buy can first time buying a all use camera and I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Cool product good price
Reviews.Author: Matthew Ignoffo "Matty"
Reviews.Content: I use for underwater mussel photography and it works well. A little challenging with odd natural lighting, but overall works well. A good price for what you get. Also surprisingly well performance on land.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Outdoor Choice
Reviews.Author: LUIS LOPEZ
Reviews.Content: Excelent camera for outdoor normal photos, the quality of the video is great so are the photos when the ilumination comes from nature endeavors!

Reviews.Title: Perfect kid friendly camera
Reviews.Author: Happy camper
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Great quality pictures for a point and shoot. Love the underwater feature. I have dropped this camera and it survived without a scratch. I can give it to my 4 year old to take photos and not worry about it being destroyed. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: It woks
Reviews.Author: saeid moslehpour
Reviews.Content: Be have had this product for four months and it is great. the GPS is great and battery lasts w while.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: juanteddy
Reviews.Content: This is a camera for life. Amazing. Good pictures, works in the water, it feels so strong, shoots in HD incredible good with good sound. An overall excelent camera for the everyday, and everyday could be a very adventourous life.

Reviews.Title: Another Great Camera from Canon
Reviews.Author: Warren Wm Gollop
Reviews.Content: I recently was gifted an upgrade from my Powershot D10 to a Powershot D20.  So far so good. It is everything I expected based on my user experience with the D10.  It take a little getting used to the controls being switched up a bit, but that is minor. So far I'm liking the improved packaging, with the exception of the thumb rest on the back of the camera. It is a little too easy to press the zoom instead of the thumb rest when taking pictures, especially if you have long and big fingers. I do like the visual cues on the compartment doors to let you know they're locked.  That certainly would have saved my D10 (although I think the seals are worn on that one) Gone are the multi-ports for the wrist strap attachment, but in its place is a single anchor point, which is the only one I ever used on my D10 anyway, so it worked out well.Refresh rates seem quite good and fast between shots. With the same battery pack used as on my old D10, it was great to know I did not have to stock up on spares again!  Battery life is still less than I would like, but the batteries are quick to charge and if you have spares, your day will go great. The larger HD screen is another nice touch, and the auto rotation is very slick. With my D10 I could never view the portrait orientation on the screen through polarized sunglasses; on the D20 I have not experienced this issue.All in all another winner from Canon in this category. I can't wait to try out even more features!

Reviews.Title: Great camera but slow shutter
Reviews.Author: Kate Sailborn
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great vacation camera to use at the beach or the pool.  The different shooting settings are useful and the video quality is good.  The shutter speed though is on the slower side.  It was difficult getting focused shots underwater because of lower light and moving subjects.  In bright afternoon light, in absolutely clear water, shots were much better.The camera is also very tough.  I dropped it (on accident) 3 feet onto a hard tile floor and it was fine.  My husband also stepped on it by the pool, scrapping it across ground, and it survived with a few scratches.  The size is nice and compact.  Not too bulky.  I loved not having to worry about water and sand getting on the camera.For the price point, I'd definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Sarah "sjshoppy"
Reviews.Content: I have owned an older Olympus waterproof camera and liked it okay. I treated it quite rough but it lasted about 4 years, now certain elements have stopped working, like the flash. When I decided to replace it I was torn between the D20 and the new olympus camera (which was over $100 more when I bought this). I also own a Canon S100 that has a great feature in which it takes a short little movie with each picture you take. At the end of the day you have a short little video (it puts them all into one video) of your day. I really enjoy that feature and because this camera had it as well, I got it.After using it for 2 trips in which it was swam with, tossed around in the surf on paddleboards, dropped in the sand, and plunged into the water during a jump, it had no issues. The picture quality is amazing compared to the older waterproof cameras. For a ponit and shoot, I think the quality is great! It is a little grainy in low light, not as good as other point and shoots.The video does record some camera noise as it focuses and zooms, but I wasn't suprised at that. Also, the shape is a little strange and it's larger than most point and shoots. That being said, I am very happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Tough little camera
Reviews.Author: Martin K. Kemmerling
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera to take on a rafting trip through the Grand Canyon.  This little camera took a real beating, got wet repeatedly, was in wet environments when stored (high humidity) and never missed a beat.  I used it to take good video as well as a few photos.  The photos were excellent quality for a small camera.  My criticism of the camera is that the write speed (at least for the SD card I used) was moderately slow.  My worst criticism is that the lens is right in the location where I wanted to hold the camera during taking video of going through rapids on the Colorado.  On numerous occasions, my fingers covered a part of the lens and are visible in the video.  I wish the lens were located a bit further down the body.  Otherwise, this camera really shined in regard to toughness and waterproofness (if that is a word).

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater pictures
Reviews.Author: ttss
Reviews.Content: This was my third time snorkeling and my 3rd camera. 1st outing I bought a Intova which was a basic point and shoot digital camera packaged with an hard shell underwater case. The biggest downfall was I could not see the preview screen underwater so I had to aim blindly and shoot. Picture quality was so-so. Due to the inability to see the preview screen on this camera on the next outing I used an older Kodak Easyshare with an optical viewfinder that I considered expendable and bought a DiCaPak case. The DiCaPak case worked as advertised and with the optical viewfinder I was able to see what I was shooting. Biggest downside was the controls were hard to operate and the battery on the camera didn't last long. Photo quality was much improved but not great. Wanting something better I did some more research and ended up buying the Canon PowerShot D20. My biggest fear was without the optical viewfinder I again would not be able to see what I was taking a picture of - this was not the case as the preview screen was easy to see underwater. The camera absolutely worked as advertised and underwater picture quality was excellent. That said this camera is what it is and that's a rugged waterproof camera you can take anywhere. I consider the above water pictures I took with this camera to be average for a point and shoot - nowhere near what I get with my Nikon D60, but then again I didn't expect them to be. I bought this camera for underwater use and those pictures came out fantastic. Color was great and the pictures were extremely sharp. Even used in underwater macro mode with great results. The only way you are going to get better underwater pictures is to use a DSLR with a hard shell underwater case for which you'll spend a minimum of $1,000 for the package.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: sherron l. francis
Reviews.Content: really had fun with this camera---I took family vacation water fun photos and then took more serious shots for our web site and some scenes for face book---was surprised how clear and what good quality they were---love it

Reviews.Title: Canon D20
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S. Meyer "jsmmeyer"
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera 3 weeks now. This camera has performed beyond my expectations. Easy to use and the quality of the images I've captured I'm quite pleased with. This camera has replaced an underwater camcorder setup I had a few years back and worked flawlessly on a snorkling trip The Keys and a few backyard pool parties as well. Additionally the various functions and pictures types add some creative elements to my pictures. Currently the 120 FPS and 240 FPS movie modes added some great effects to some water skiing video. This camera has made a nice addition to my other Canon cameras I own. This is a great adventure camera especially for times when conditions may not be suitable for SLR's but you want to capture some pics or video.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D20 a nice camera
Reviews.Author: Dorice Isaac
Reviews.Content: I got this camera after I lost the previous Canon Powershot D10.  I think the picture quality is just as good as the previous version though there is a very slight bit more of a lag in the shutter (but it's still good).  I have not used it underwater yet, but I imagine those pictures will be just fine.  I chose the D20 over another D10 because of the slimmer body.  It is a large camera, but it fits nicely in my hand.  Underwater, I would like to have a good grip and the curvature on the side provides that, as well as, another place you can hook a strap for those lefties.  The big blue buttons stand out nicely as well.  Although, the camera is larger, it is still small enough and slim enough to fit in an average sized pocket.  The door to release the battery and memory card is easier to open than the D10.  Overall, I am happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: #1 Choice
Reviews.Author: Lin
Reviews.Content: The best camera I've ever owned. The lighting is perfect everytime I use this camera. I have owned Sony first, a Nikon, and now this Cannon and it is been absolutely wonderful. I will always own Cannon. I do recommend rinsing it off in fresh tap water every time you use it in chlorine or salt water to wash away the film on it.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality!
Reviews.Author: Amazing Grace
Reviews.Content: I had previously owned the D10, so I knew the powershot line was a good underwater camera. We just returned from the Keys and the pictures came out great. I decided to pack lite and leave my SLR at home. I was pleasantly surprised with the pictures both above and below the water. It is slimmer and more compact in design then the D10. I like the finish on the camera it gives you more grip. The camera has a great zoom and the quality was very good from a distance. Occasionally the finger ended up in the picture, the lens is in the upper left and its easy to grab the wrong way especially when under water, this is really the only downfall I found of this D20 camera. If you looking for a great underwater, even the video of a spotted eagle ray came out crisp and clear until I got over excited trying to keep my eyes on him and get my family's attention. I really was looking for an underwater camera only but was happy to discover I can use this as an all around when I don't feel like carrying the big SLR. The viewing window is also much larger then the D10. You could clearly see what you were taking a picture of in the window.Going from closer range to far was not very easily arranged on the cameras button design. Loved the red record button made it easy to switch to when a shark or something neat came along to video. The video button drains the battery life, so make sure you have a spare if you plan on doing much video. I always purchase an extra battery so you never miss a picture waiting for a battery to charge.  Make sure you soak it after using underwater, it extends the life of the camera greatly! In all I would purchase this camera again and recommend it the picture quality is fantastic and that's really what is important in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera !!!
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: Shipping was fast.  Love this camera.  Just used it on a 7 day Western Caribbean cruise.  Used it at Dunns River Falls, Jamaica in the water.  Great shots.  Also used it underwater snorkeling in Labadee Haiti and Cozumel Mexico.  Incredibly easy to use and great underwater shots.  Took about 2 minutes to teach the wife to use it.  Very easy.  Battery life is very good also.  Didn't have to recharge until day 6 on the cruise.  Glad I bought it, would but it again and will recommend to all friends.  Thanks Canon and Thanks Amazon.  Very Happy !!

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot D20
Reviews.Author: carsalja
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, I bought it to go to Hawai. Took nice photos and videos inside the water as well as outside.This is my first experience with a waterproof digital camera.Thanks to Amazon, for the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: Perfect gadget one more time from Canon.
Reviews.Author: Aleks
Reviews.Content: Best wp camera around here, waterproof till 33 meters (water will not go inside but you will be unable to press buttons, tested.)For me it looks that good old D10 has better picture sharpens, but this one is much better all around :)

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: M. Gann
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a Caribbean cruise. I like to snorkel. I used it at the first port in the water with no problems. When I got back on the ship, I left the camera to soak in fresh water for several hours in the bathroom sink. At the next port the camera would not power up. Since it's past the time frame to return the camera to Amazon, I am stuck with an expensive camera that I got one days worth of use out of. I'm extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: What a waste!
Reviews.Author: Arash
Reviews.Content: I bought this product as an upgrade to my old "Canon PowerShot D10", but after comparing the image quality I must say, to my disappointment, it has a generally lower image quality, meaning the images have lesser details and more chromatic aberration. Size wise, though the camera thickness has been reduced, the surface has become wider and bigger.To conclude, if you already have a "Canon PowerShot D10", do not buy this as an upgrade, because it is not! and if you are looking for a good underwater camera, buy the "Canon PowerShot D10"!

Reviews.Title: WHEN IT WORKED FOR THE FIRST 4 SNORKELING TRIPS IT  TOOK GREAT PICTURES -- THEN IT STOPPED WORKING.
Reviews.Author: EDWARD R. GALAS
Reviews.Content: I GAVE THE CAMERA 5 STARS BECAUSE OF THE QUALITY OF THE  PHOTOS IT TOOK AND THE EASE OF USAGE. HOWEVER WHEN I USED IT SNORKELING AFTER THE 4TH TRIP . THE CAMERA STOPPED WORKING -- FIRST IT FOGGED AND THEN IT STOPPED COMPLETELY. I HAD THE CANON D- 10 FOR FOUR YEARS AND IT STILL WORKED GREAT. I GAVE IT TO A FRIEND. I AM HOPING THAT  MY EXPERIENCE WITH THE D-20 IS A FLUKE AND THAT THE NEW ONE AMAZON WILL SEND ME WILL WORK PROPERLY AND PERFORM JUST LIKE MY OLD D -10 .  AGAIN I HOPE THE SECOND ONE IS A CHARM-OTHERWISE I'LL HAVE TO SWITCH TO A DIFFERENT UNDERWATER CAMERA . TKS ED GALAS

Reviews.Title: Good pictures especially underwater. good quality camera
Reviews.Author: cam
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon elph before and I really like the picture quality but I decided to get a waterproof camera for the following reasons. We live in the pacific northwest which means that it rains a lot and second, we love to go to beaches if we go on vacation. So this is just the perfect camera for us. It really take good pictures especially underwater. I gave it 4 stars because it doesn't take good pictures at night or when there is not much light. But other than that, it is really a good camera. It is shock proof too. I can't count the times that my daughter drop this camera from her hand, but it still works.

Reviews.Title: Love it so far
Reviews.Author: D. Bellows "dkb354"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had it in the water, though plan on it this summer.  Great pics and video though.  One button video, made if very easy to video my grandson at the skate park.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D20
Reviews.Author: bill feeny
Reviews.Content: Small. Relatively good resolution. Robust. It is easy to put your left index finger over the lens which is mildly annoying. I haven't played with most of the bangs and whistles. Dealing with menus is frustrating and time consuming. This is true of all digital cameras. Best thing is it is perfect for outdoor adventure such as running around in monsoons, raft trips, getting squirted by an elephant, splashing around on the beach, snorkeling, etc... Battery life is good. 2 years ago I brought two D10s with me on an overnight raft trip on the Pai River which was useful as when the battery ran out I simply switched cameras. I now have a fine archive of images to keep the memories alive. I usually bring an extra battery with me when on some weird adventure and that has worked well. Quality of image and ease of use is not like the old days with my Canon FTB but digital pays for itself after about 300 shots when you consider the cost of film & processing.

Reviews.Title: Camera leaked the first time I used it
Reviews.Author: Sjane
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for taking pictures while snorkeling on vacation.  It leaked and quit working the first time I tried to use it in the water.  Now Canon is giving me the run around about replacing it.  I'm not happy.

Reviews.Title: Good But Not Great!
Reviews.Author: Ayjent007
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a Caribbean vacation. The waterproof feature and underwater videos were fantastic. The camera is attractive, compact with a solid casing and the LCD is large and bright. There were a couple of issues I wasn't too satisfied with.....see the list below.The lens would quickly fog once taken out of the water.Outdoor pictures appeared with a reddish hue if you forget to change the settings from underwater mode.Upon re-surfacing watermarks would form on the lens, making your pictures appear with spots.The camera lens is position on the upper left corner which can be an obstruction when holding the camera with two hands.Camera does not include a floating accessory.Underwater pictures are poor during cloudy weather.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Vbrob
Reviews.Content: I have had my D10 for over two years and it is a constant companion on our trips.  It's my go to camera for snorkeling or in adverse weather conditions.  It has never failed me except for one minor detail that took me a bit of time to resolve.  Before I bought the camera I had read owner reviews which described  a lens error problem - in fact one owner returned the camera because he couldn't eliminate the problem.  If the lens error appears the camera is rendered useless.  I didn't experience the problem until recently.I can reproduce the problem when the camera is in the playback mode - simply press the shutter button and the lens error appears.  I'm sure that this has happened to others by accident.  The way to resolve the problem is to turn off the camera, remove the battery for a few minutes, replace the battery and turn on the camera.  Repeat if it doesn't clear the first time, wait a few more minutes before replacing the battery.It may be a minor annoyance but the camera is not broken.Other than that minor issue the camera has been flawless within its limits - as has been noted by others this is not an expensive DSLR and does have limitations.  But it will take good quality shots in better light conditions.I have always had Canon cameras and will remain loyal when I want a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Very bad experience
Reviews.Author: Indra
Reviews.Content: The camera 10 minutes after being under water is wet inside and I could not use more until you've tried dry and dip again very bad experience

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: emjmorgan11
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a week or two but I like it so far. I can be a little rough with cameras and my past 2 have broke because I have dropped them. I was at a field party this weekend and seemed to do perfectly fine. I have not had a chance to use it underwater yet. There are some minor things that irritate me though. The wrist tie is located on the left side of the camera, while the shutter button is on the right. So sometimes the wrist tie will get in the way of the picture. Also, the preview button is located right next to the shutter button so if someone else is taking a picture who is not familiar, sometimes they hit that button instead of the shutter. Also, there is not an option where you can have the flash on permanently, only on auto or no flash. But I like the camera overall.

Reviews.Title: warranty
Reviews.Author: karinna ferrini
Reviews.Content: The 9 of September, I bought in AMAZON a Canon camera Power Shot D20 waterproof 10m/33ft. In May 2014 I traveled and I took this camera. On 10th of May I entered the camera at the sea to take pictures and it began to fail until finally it doesn't work more. I saw inside the lens same waterdrops.I don`t understand how can enter water to a waterproof camera  that is tightly closed (as the manual says), having given proper treatment at the camera, not having submerged more than 1 meter deep and having used a few times in less than 1 year?? I want an explication of your part and the replace of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Bought it to replace the previous model
Reviews.Author: Jesica Davis
Reviews.Content: These Canon waterproof cameras are as sturdy as they say, and I need that because I have young children who like to grab my camera. The picture quality is generally good, but my one serious complaint about this model is that the options are more limited than on the previous one. I particularly liked the filter for shooting in greenery that the last one had. This one has more focus on underwater capabilities, but because I shoot more frequently in the woods than underwater, that doesn't matter to me.

Reviews.Title: canon.
Reviews.Author: john Wehner
Reviews.Content: Camera takes good pictures but digital zoom could work better. Going to try it at a springs in fl . I hope it works on underwater pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Fornetti
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It is everything the advertising says it is and takes great pictures.  Works very well under water.

Reviews.Title: Canon, nuff said
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Can't beat Canon when you are looking for a camera. Took this to the Bahamas and it worked flawlessly. On land and in the water, great pictures and easy to use.Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!
Reviews.Author: gvoivodas
Reviews.Content: Best Camera i've ever had considering that price!!Get it and begin your excursions!Underwater shooting is soooooo funny!!!!! thanks Canon!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: mnkyville
Reviews.Content: I bought it at Costco in Hawaii, it was the best purchase I've ever made. It zooms really well and takes the most wonderful pictures, in water or not, I love this camera!!!!I paid $285 and it was well worth the price, if you want a waterproof camera or just a camera, I highly recommend this one!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerSot
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I love it. I have not had any problems with it so far. The pictures underwater come out clear. If you are looking for a waterproof camera I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: BATTERY
Reviews.Author: CHANDINI
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THE PICTURE QUALITY OF THIS CAMERA,BUT I AM DISAPPOINTED WITH ITS BATTERY LIFE.IT DOESNT LAST VERY LONG.IS IT APROBLEM WITH MY CAMERA ALONE????

Reviews.Title: Extremely durable
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for a friend who does some crazy stuff (e.g. abalone diving).  This camera has survived his adventures for more than a year and it's going strong.  The photo quality is excellent for the extreme environments it can operate in, but if you aren't taking photos underwater, in a sand dune, or down a ski slope, you're better off with a normal point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: 100% ok
Reviews.Author: Fernando Meister
Reviews.Content: Recebi a mercadoria sem nenhum problema dentro do prazo que foi estipulado para entrega. Vendedor recomendado. Produto de qualidade. obrigado.

Reviews.Title: Broken?
Reviews.Author: Kelly K.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if anyone else has had this issue, but my new camera isn't working. It doesn't seem to want to hold a charge... I put a brand new fully charged battery in it the other day, and played around with it taking pictures in various lightings around the house and turned it off, a few hours later i turned it back on and then it just shut off like 5 seconds later mid-picture. I thought that was a bit weird and thought maybe it was a bad battery. So i put another brand new battery in it today (I ordered extras), and within 4 minutes it shut off. I tried the third, fully charged battery, and same thing....I haven't even been able to test the underwater part yet. I'm really disappointed because the few pictures and one video i've taken thus far turned out really nice. But that's worthless if i can't take more than 10 pictures!Also, there seems to be a piece that sounds loose inside the camera? is that normal???

Reviews.Title: Save your money
Reviews.Author: Tony Wood "Tony"
Reviews.Content: Bottom line:  The image quality was poor, the structure is clunky and awkward, the wrist strap is for left-handers and it's heavy.  Not impressed at any level.

Reviews.Title: really good product
Reviews.Author: J. Pandya "thrifty shopper"
Reviews.Content: bought for my sister, who is doing her phd in marine biology, she takes pictures of corals, with this camera, and the quality is really clear and sharp,

Reviews.Title: ALMOST PERFECT
Reviews.Author: ERCONTI
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT IT AND A FEW DAYS LATER I WAS SNORKELING IN SHARM EL SHEIKH BEAUTIFUL SEA.THE CAMERA HAS A GREAT GRIP, THE DISPLAY IS NOT VERY BRILLIANT UNDER THE SEA BUT THE IMAGES, BOTH PICS AND VIDEOS, ARE SIMPLY GREAT.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof Failure In Jamaica
Reviews.Author: ggarcia
Reviews.Content: I rented this camera for a trip to Jamaica specifically to take pictures while snorkeling and a possible scuba dive on 5/23.  I took plenty of land photos before heading out to snorkel and it worked just fine. I'm used to canon camera's and picture were as expected.I took 4 pictures while snorkeling before the camera showed a message requesting to restart the camera.  I restarted and took 2 more pictures before the screen froze with just a few lines showing up briefly and then it went black.  I tried to turn it back on while in the water but it wouldn't turn on.  I didn't bother with it anymore after that until we returned to the hotel room.  I took a good look at the camera before opening any doors and was able to see water in the lens.  Enough water to tilt the camera different ways and make it look like one of those globes with a little boat on water and blue oil.  The camera had been out of the water for about 30/45 minutes at this point and the screen had condensation built up on the inside.I tried to check if I didn't seal something right, but the doors were all shut, no red on the door clip was visible and doors were properly aligned.  I opened the battery/card door first and water was present throughout the compartment, on the battery, on the card and the door.  I opened the media door and water was present throughout this compartment also. I ejected battery and the sd card and water was visible on all sides of both. I wiped dry what I could and left the camera to dry in the room which was kept cool.  The camera has not successfully powered on yet and my rental period ends tomorrow 5/29. I was able to confirm that the sd card was not damaged and all pictures were present; including the 6 pictures from the snorkeling trip (it's a Kingston card, which I now fully recommend).This camera isn't supposed to be an ordinary point and shoot. It's supposed to be able to take a bit more of a licking and survive in the water.  It didn't work out for me.  We never made it past about 7 feet of water when this incident happened and the length of time in the water was about 5-10 minutes.  I like Canon camera's.  It's a shame this one didn't work out.  I hear the D10 is a solid performer.  Hopefully this was just a lemon.  I'd like to try another to see what happens.  I hope this was useful to you.

Reviews.Title: Decent images, terrible sound quality
Reviews.Author: Mark M Sheeres
Reviews.Content: It works great for me taking pictures and videos underwater. However, the sound quality is terrible. Everything is so muffled you have to turn the volume way up just to hear anything, and when you do you hear all this loud clicking and clacking over top the muffled voices. It is so bad I brought it back to the camera store and they sent it back to Canon TWICE to fix what I thought must surely be broken, it's that bad, but both times Canon sent it back and said, "No, it's fine, that's the way it sounds."So, get it if you plan to just take pictures, or just video that you'll dub over later, because the sound quality is very disappointing. I would not buy this camera again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: I'm Sorry Canon, But You Let Me Down (Canon PowerShot D20 12.1 MP)
Reviews.Author: Broderick Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my outdoor adventures...I have always been a Canon fan and have owned 10+ Canon Digital Cameras including their last waterproof Powershot....this one is such a disappointment.When I go to snap a shot, the camera often pauses for a long period of time and I miss a shot or frustrate the subject.Picture quality is poor 50% of the time.In the dark, little white fuzzy balls show up...I had to exchange the 1st one I purchased because it leaked.This one has thankfully not leaked.But all and all I really wish I could return this camera.  Do yourself a favor and look at some other versions.I initially felt bad ripping a Canon Product, but maybe Canon will read this and improve...

Reviews.Title: The pictures and color are not as sharp as I had hoped.
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: I am a camera novice and did lots of research before buying this camera. I have only had it for two months and I am dissapointed with the pictures it has taken. The colors are not true and there is no way to manually adjust the iso. Forget about taking pictures at night. What am I doing wrong?

Reviews.Title: Display died after taking 2 pictures underwater
Reviews.Author: JTK
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera wanting to upgrade my Canon D10.  First time snorkeling after taking only 2 pictures the display went completely BLACK.  Tried everything to get it to work but the display never came back on.  I had taken other great pictures out of the water but specifically bought this for snorkeling.  I am in the process of returning.  Very Disappointing.  I would stay away from this Canon model.

Reviews.Title: Sweet!
Reviews.Author: coyotesings "coyotesings"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera and although I haven't used it in the water yet I must say the ease of use is so much better than my Polaroid waterproof camera.  Being Canon the controls are consistent with their other cameras, of which I own 3, and this one has a deeper water rating than my Polaroid.  The only issue I have is the use of battery packs instead of standard batteries.  However, the packs charge quickly with the included charger, and I purchased a spare battery pack (see previous review) for a good price that will hopefully see me through a long day of shooting.  If you do purchase this camera remember to buy an SD card for it as it does not come with one.  This camera is loaded with GPS to add location to your photos.  It also has a setting for underwater photography which should bring out the color that many cameras lack.  I will update my review once I've had the opportunity to use it in the water.

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: ronen013
Reviews.Content: very nice camera,price is little high.before that i had the Olympus tough 8100 and the pictures of the canon powershot d20 are a lot better.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: puggsie's mom "puggsielove"
Reviews.Content: I am in love with the new Canon powershot d20.  I have researched a lot of the waterproof camera's out there to replace my broken Olympus point and shoot and was not impressed at all with other reviews so I decided to get a good old canon.So far I have only taken land shots and haven't tested the waterproofness of the camera but I am loving how my pictures are coming out and the brightness and color they are showing is just amazing.I love that the battery and card door aren't that easy to open so you don't need to worry about them getting wet or just by chance opening with your hand or in your purse or pocket like other point and shoots will do.  The Zoom on this camera is also amazing for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: well waterproo, poor image quality in picture, well image quality in video
Reviews.Author: cynthia
Reviews.Content: it works very well under water, really waterproof. The image quality is even poor than my Samsung NV3 (bought four years age at around $200), but well image quality in video.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre pictures
Reviews.Author: Darryl Hw Johnston "Reader"
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's waterproof and yes it takes pictures.  But the quality of the pictures leaves lots and lots to be desired.  Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: jehobiewan
Reviews.Content: Preordered this camera a couple months back.  I have had it a couple weeks now and absolutely love it.  It takes fantastic pictures every time.

Reviews.Title: SUPER
Reviews.Author: Linda L. Blair
Reviews.Content: The Canon d20 Has lived up to all my high expectations. I always trust canon cameras. The picture quality is sharp and clear. The ease of operation is quite easy.

Reviews.Title: Make sure to attach the strap to the camera
Reviews.Author: Safety
Reviews.Content: Takes decent pictures but literally lost the camera on my second time in the water of using it. I read all the reviews and did my homework. Even bought the floating strap so it doesn't get lost. None of this will do me any good if the little knob that attaches to the camera falls out. I made sure to click it in and do a slight tug to make sure it was secure. After about 10 minutes of being I the ocean it was lost at sea. I lost all my pictures from a once in a lifetime trip I can not get back. Save yourself some heart ache and ignore the knob and secure it to the other side even if you are right handed.

Reviews.Title: Looks good
Reviews.Author: Barb
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived before expected - this was great!  Have not tired to take pictures yet as have to purchase a memory disk.  Cannot rate properly yet.

Reviews.Title: False Advertising!!!  This unit does not work using Windows XP
Reviews.Author: Marilyn L Hilbers
Reviews.Content: This unit is advertised as being compitable with Windows XP SP3.  It definitely NOT!!!  I spent HOURS on the phone with Canon.  They claim it is compatible.  i tried two different XP computers and it definitely is not.  Cannon refuses to provide software -- driver -- they use to make it compatible.  They say Microsoft provides it.  I spent $200 and 6 hours talking to Microsoft and they agree that there is no Microsoft XP driver.  So the bottom line is that the camera pictures can only be downloaded from the SD card.  The USB cable provided cannot be used for XP.  The software runs on XP but the cammera will not connect using it.

Reviews.Title: just a great hardy point and shoot
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a great harsy point and sh9t and I cannoy ask for anything more. I love the outdoors. I fish. hunt, hike and offroad. I need somethin that can get wet or dirty and still keep workin. The main reason I bought this was that I could go on trips and instead of cknstamtly worrying about my dslr I could relax. I have had no issues throwing this in the cump holder on rocky offroading trips and it was been in the deep end of a friends pool as well has dropped in the sand ( and rinsed off with fresh water). I am glad I made this purchase. If you like outdoor sports and you need a good reliable camera id choose this. It takes good wuakity pictures. A bit grainy when the digital zoom is super high but hey its not a dslr. I can't expect that wuality. Ranking it against high end point and shoot I would stick it a little about thrre quarters.

Reviews.Title: So disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Laura  C. Chaverri
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Canons over the past 32 years and have been very happy with them. I bought myself the D10 last November for a snorkeling trip to the Caribbean and it did fine. It takes great pictures out of the water.  On a separate trip to Costa Rica in May it started taking on water when taking pictures while wading in the water and it froze up. Luckily I had a second nonwaterproof camera with me. Since it was still under warranty I was able to send it back. They felt it was unrepairable they sent me a refurbished model. Again it performed well out of the water. Last week I went snorkeling and it immediately took on water as soon as I went underwater. I contacted them again and I need to send the camera back. I really don't want another one and I am very disappointed as now it is two vacations' photos that have been ruined. I was willing to chock up the first failure to a production error but now 2 camera failures in 9 months leads me to think it may be a design error.

Reviews.Title: wow, can't wait to send it back
Reviews.Author: B "B Stewart"
Reviews.Content: i apologize if you drive a gm car, or have a porsche with pcm.  this camera belongs in that category.  for balance, my Canon S95 is the best camera i have ever owned and converted me from Nikon to Canon.  but this is more like a GM car.  Do they sit in these things before they sell them?  its clunky.  as other reviewers have noted, it has a slicky right hand grip and is better for the left hand, but worst of all, it does not stand up, unless you pay attention. i.e. if you put it down with any in attention, it falls over.  plus it was an open box. and i really think A should disclose this.the pics might be great but the clunkiness and falling over when i set it down prevent an evaluation of such.

Reviews.Title: I didn't receive the
Reviews.Author: jackie7519
Reviews.Content: I made an order by the name "Chieh Lee", but the resident of the shipping address is actually "Yi-Yin Chien". Since the names are different, the package were returned so I never received it. Could you deliver the package again with the name "Yi-Yin Chien", or just return the money and I will make a new order, please. The order number is 105-4185178-6319457, and the tracking ID is C11120581847540. Thank you for your help.
